name: Cecilia McDaniel
text: So let's be honest and brash here. Yes I am a former employee, who left the company because the current manager is a tyrant!! Today one of my associates called Hanes and asked if they could make change, the store manager got a nasty attitude, so my associate hung up. The store manager from Hanes stormed over to my store raised all kinds of hell and then had the NERVE TO ASK IF I HAVE COVID!!!... Y'all need to get her under control!! She is the sole reason I left the company!! Who or what gives her the right or the authority to ask that about other peoples private medical statuses, if there even is one?

name: Tanesha Morris
text: Go see Ms.Sylvia she was nice and sweet and she made sure my daughter had the right bra fit she will also assist you with measurements no other store I went to would help and assist like Ms.Sylvia buy three or more 40% off each

text: Went in to check out a set of irons and Connor hooked it up.  I'm fairly new to golf and he was more than happy to help out. Connor was very knowledgeable and with his help I was able to determine what size clubs I need along with which irons are best for me.  This is the kind of service that will keep customers coming back...Unlike the service I have received at the "other store" down the road.

text: I went to buy a preowned driver and Mike treated me as if I was buying a new one. He took me to the simulator and adjusted it to my swing. Thanks a lot. I will be back.

name: corrie gibson
text: Love Weaver's!! Great friendly people!!

name: Matthew Montee
text: 8/5/21 3:45 p.m.  I was on my way home from Tennessee to Florida when I stopped in this location to replace a shirt that I had torn.  When I walked in I was greeted by the 2 associates ( young men) and quickly dismissed while they argued over who was a better photoshop expert.  As I browsed the limited inventory I found 3 different shirts that would suit my needs.  I was unable to locate the size I needed and asked for assistance.  One associate seemed put-off that I was interrupting his photoshop debate while the other kept talking.  The associate walked over to where I was and asked what size I needed.  He glanced at some bins, said, "We don't have it, go online, sorry." and quickly returned to his photoshop conversation.  I asked him to check the stock room and he again directed me to go online.  I understand help is hard to come by, during these times but it was quite clear this kid was just working for the clothing discounts and not the customer service.

name: Benjamin Cox
text: This was the absolute WORST experience I’ve ever had in retail... It was so SLOW that it took the staff 25 minutes just to ring up my three items. Also one of the staff would not stop asking me personal questions and judging me when I refused to answer the question. If I am paying the high prices that I pay for those clothes, then I should have a quick and friendly service. Instead I received an incompetent cashier and an overbearing staff.

name: Elizabeth Estes
text: Sweet staff and loved that they offered a beverage upon checkout ♡ makes me want to only shop there and nowhere else .

name: Alexandria Hatfield
text:
Both summer AND winter clothing. I dropped off 5-6 bins full of men’s khaki shorts, khaki pants, jeans, dress shirts, & athletic gear. ***ALL are brand names such as POLO Ralph Lauren, J.Crew, Patagonia, Vineyard Vines, Coastal Cotton, Southern Marsh, Nike/Adidas, & much more!

***Most items are NEW w/ TAGS or barely worn clothes! All items are in GREAT CONDITION.*** (size 29-32 in mens/boys pants. Men’s size Small & Medium in shirts. Some “boys XL 18-20” in dress shirts as well.)

This is my brother’s first year at West Point (go Army!). He isn’t allowed to come home very much these next 4 years, so we have cleaned out his entire closet & have taken ALL of his clothes to Fashion Exchange in Athens, AL!

These clothes will only be allowed to stay on the floor for just 3 months. Go check them out soon!

resp.text: Thank you for your business and your kind review! We hope to see you soon!

name: Shelby Lamkin
text: HORRIBLE!! The owner is SO RUDE! Follows you around the store like you are stealing, stares at you the entire time, and makes you feel like you aren’t good enough to even be in there. I’ve been there 3 times and always had the same feeling. The owner even insulted one of my family members for the way he was dressed! I refuse to go there ever again or spend any money in there, and I will be sure to spread the word on how they run their business!

resp.text: We are sorry we made you feel uncomfortable. This was not our intention. We try to be attentive  to and create conversation with every customer.  We would love to talk to you about your experience - (205) 752-6931.

name: J Parker Rhodes
text: Never shopping here again.  One of my sales reps reached out to see if they would be interested in us sending them a holiday sample box. She was treated absolutely terrible.  There exact words were: "It's the holidays, if your line was good enough to be in our store it would be by now".   That's the kind of attitude that gets you left in the dust.

name: Ryan Grant
text: Got a hat from here, there was a small issue with it and the helpful staff sent me a replacement very promptly. Great customer service.

name: James Cain
text:
The best of the best!  A Tuscsaloosa tradition for over 40 years.  Suits and sports coats expertly fitted with service and expertise that you simply can’t find anymore.  Quality is the best you can find.  I am still wearing suits that I bought there 15 years ago!   The owner has an eye for the next big thing in fashion. And he brings it to Tuscaloosa before you can find it anywhere else.
Your new shirt will be steamed while you wait so it’s ready to wear for that big occasion.  Your pants and jacket will be fitted and altered to give you that custom made look.
If you want the best service and best selection, go to The Shirt Shop, a Tuscaloosa icon.

name: Sabrina Steuber
text: I have only visited your store once when I visited Tuscaloosa and my experience was a positive one, I truly love all the game day shirts! I am an online shopper and always end up purchasing your Comfort Colors elephant shirts/tank tops. Shipping is very fast and great quality as usual! Love this store. Roll Tide!

name: Cristine Kuo
text: I absolutely love this store! I usually order online since I live in Tennessee, but whenever I order their merchandise it ships promptly and the customer service is great. I absolutely LOVE their rival t-shirts. It’s my favorite and I have been ordering all of them for the past several years! Thanks again for making these great shirts!

name: Logan Newsome
text: Shopped here on the Saturday before Christmas and although I don’t usually leave reviews I was impressed with this stores service and quality of their products. The staff was very friendly and helpful in finding just the right items for my needs. You will never find this level of service, nor the quality in the big box stores. Thank you Shirt Shop for assisting me in purchasing the best Christmas gifts! I will definitely return.

name: Jeremy Hudson
text: The staff here is what makes this place the best. I’ve never met people who were so into providing the best customer service experience around. I got a size too large in a jacket once and I had to exchange it. Not only did Bethany go find jackets in my size but elected not to charge me the difference in price. I always get the help and knowledge of the products in store to assure I’ve got the right size in my hand at checkout! Not only that, but they are quick to respond to my Instagram messages, and send me products!

name: Tanner Corley
text: they have great staff. helpful in every way possible. very friendly also. if you’re in tuscaloosa stop by and check them out

name: Ashlyn Pounders
text: I love the Shirt Shop! Great products and even better customer service! Highly recommend :)

name: Alan Ruth
text: A great store and Charles will definitely take care of you. Visiting from CO and they were very accommodating as we arrived right before closing. They helped my daughter find what she had been looking for. Thank you! Great service!!!

name: Kyle Jernigan
text: See. Leck. Shun.  Selection.  And service.  That's the 2 things I always find at this place. Yes, there is a ton of inventory but that's because they have 100 different options from which to choose - just when picking out a button up shirt. It's the same for slacks or a suit, they have every option you can imagine or have seen online. They don't have " just blue and white" button downs, they have every possible style/color/pattern which is awesome. It's almost hard to make a decision but they help you narrow it down to what you really like. They greet you when you walk in and help you find what you want and they don't show you something you may not like. And then they make sure it fits. Imagine having someone show you around, help you find just what you like, and then making sure it fits you just right. It's one of the finer things you can enjoy.

name: Stacey Lynch
text: This place would be decent if there wasn’t so much stuff shoved in one tiny place.

name: Trey Bagnardi
text: This place was not worth my time. I thought it would be super helpful and I would be able to find what I wanted, but I could not find anything. The shirts also smell really bad.

text: They treated me with respect and were very helpful in finding an item that was right for me not just a sale

name: Wendy Sherrod
text: Wanted to buy something for Christmas, but the website was just too complicated. I recommend moving to a new website builder.

name: Liz Dickenson
text: Great, fun store. I enjoy the experience completely, and highly recommend it to my friends traveling thru T-town. The Spurlins are a local treasure. I always stop in on my way thru. Great merchandise and I always find something I need!

text: Friendly staff, nice clothes

text: This store has a lot of potential, just needs a better eye for fashion and possibly a nice cleaning:)))

text: Been shopping at the Shirt Shop since I was a student at BAMA. One of the absolute best places to get good clothes!

name: Emily Johnson
text: The Shirt Shop is the best of the best! The best customer service and for sure the best products!

name: Chip Gentry
text: I visited in June '15. Greeted with a genuine southern hospitality I would have expected nothing less.  The stores staff is amazingly well versed on clothing trends, styles and fittings. With a passive soft selling techniques.  True haberdasher experience.

name: John Smith
text: Beware... !!!Rude owner.. Disrespectful.. Will never go back.. Downright Nasty Man...

name: David Martin
text: Love the clothes here. Unique and trendy. Best service in Tuscaloosa for men's retail clothing. A must stop for any Tuscaloosa visit.

name: Tatianna Mondaini
text: First time visiting this store today with my family in town for Easter, and the staff followed us around the store acting like we were going to steal something. When we left after looking around, one of the staff members followed us outside to see what we were doing/if we had stolen something. I won't be visiting again, and I do not like to feel like I'm being watched when I'm shopping and I'm genuinely just looking around.

name: Lindsay Meacham
text: Love The Shirt Shop! Mr. Spurlin and his staff are always very helpful and friendly and the selection of clothing is endless! Whether you are looking for Alabama game day apparel or just classy, traditional style clothing they have everything you need!

name: Josh Smitherins
text: 5 out of 5. Not too much experience with this place, but the few times I have been it has been good. I purchased a high dollar pair of sunglasses from here.  I ended up having an allergic reaction to the nose pads.  I took them back to the store a week later and they had no problem exchanging them for another pair.  Service is always friendly with somebody always asking if you need help when walking in (but not in a pushy kind of way).

name: Cory McGuffie
text: I have shopped here for many years. Now that I live out of town I still make special trips to come back and shop at the Shirt Shop!!!

name: Wendy Smith
text: Customer service was excellent , even with a store full of shoppers.  Great selection and quality.

name: S. B.
text: I went to this store over many years after graduating from Alabama buying $1000's worth of merchandise in the past.  This past year I picked a Peter Millar Windbreaker that Charles Spurlin the owner personally said he would get monogrammed for me, I paid for the windbreaker and the monogram and left expecting to pick up in a week.  I live out of town and made a special trip back to pick up the next week.  On arrival Charles notified me that the logo was printed upside down (duh!) and that he would get another one and have it done with either the retro Alabama logo or get a new windbreaker.  I returned for the third time and he told me it wasn't done and that he would refund my purchase price.  Well Charles you cost me three private trips to your store, endless aggravation of incompetence and not receiving the windbreaker that I chose and paid for.   My time is valuable so we are not "square".  What is even worse, I gave you my number and you said you would call me to let me know what could be done.  Needless to say, I heard nothing.

name: Ted Turner
text: Best shirts in T-Town..Charles, the owner is a great man to know.. he will treat you right.

name: Jin Zhao
text: Bought some Roll Tide caps. Nice place.

name: Carly Mullady Cowan
text:
I've ordered online several times and was very excited to bring my upcoming freshman brother to the shop, which carries many items we *would* have been interested in purchasing. I almost purchased groomsman shirts from them last fall and am so relieved I didn't. I will not so much as order online ever again. I'm in my 30s and was well dressed aside from a necessary Columbia rain jacket and was joined by my mother and younger brother. When you walk in, it feels like an episode of Hoarders. Everything is everywhere. Stacks. Piles. Overstuffed racks. No sense of organization. It feels like an overstocked Goodwill with name brand stickers strewn about. Prices may or may not be on items. Seeing how poorly $80+ shirts are kept in the store is a definite turnoff.
Even less settling however, was being followed by the staff as if I was going to stuff their items in my small Kate Spade crossbody bag. Should the three of us separate in the tiny shop, there'd be a person on each of us at the snap of a finger--and this is after I found a staff member's cell phone in a pile of clothes and turned it in to them. As we perused, I heard them complaining "OH. THAT is why they're here. Orientation."
That's when I rounded up the crew and we visited different stores with organization, fantastic selections, and genuinely kind staff.
Save yourself frustration, a headache, and money. Skip this stop.

name: Shelby Shaw
text: I love that I can always find the hottest trends! Glad to have a store like this in Bama!

name: Philip Huff
text: The best service I've ever had from a clothing store!!  Thanks Charles! RTR

text: I had a great experience at the Shirt Shop. The staff was very helpful and patient. Thanks for the shirt and belt!

text: One of the employee's was really rude to me when I asked for her assistance. I asked her a question about a gift certificate I purchased the night before for the store and she told me they would not honor it because they were not participating in the site anymore. That is bad customer service, I work in retail and that was not the proper procedure if I had the certificate present with me as well as made a payment of $50 already. I will not step foot in the Shirt Shop ever again and that is a promise.

name: Chelsea Hoffman
text:
Awful experience. The girls behind the counter were making fun of other coworkers and I was treated as if I was going to steal something. The girl was motioning when she thought I wasn’t looking and said, I’m keeping these boxes.

Then, when I got to the register, the shoes were more expensive than I thought. Because of that and what happened earlier, I walked out and left the shoes. I won’t be back.

I would have let two of the staff members go on the spot, if I were their manager. Be polite, professional and push the buttons on the register. That’s all. Otherwise, go home.

I’m currently headed to another store to buy the exact same pair of shoes. Thanks.

name: Mike Williams
text: Too hippy for me

name: Crystal McCreight
text:
My first experience in there was positive. I didn’t need any assistance and I got what i wanted and checked out quickly @ about  8:30pm
The next day however they were very rude. I got a pair of shorts for 19.99 on sale; my SIL decided she wanted a pair we asked them to check the price and they refused! like it was the biggest  Inconvenience to run the scanner over the barcode 🤦‍♀️🤦‍♀️ they insisted I must have bought a pair that said s18 as in last season. I checked my tag when I got home and sure enough they said s19 just like the rest of the shorts on the rack that looked identical  ... seriously though would it have killed them just to check instead of insisting that they couldn’t have possibly been on sale!!

text:
My husband and I have been patronizing Evening Out Formal Wear for over 25 years! They provide excellent customer service and quality tuxedos. As we celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary in the 26th year, there is only one tuxedo location we would trust with dressing the "Groom". Thank you Evening Out Formal Wear for being exceptional!

~Michael and Bernadette Chapple

name: Marc Wilder
text: Well my wedding day or these pics wouldn’t have been a success without Evening Out! Mr. Salter is top notch with customer service and his attention to the smallest details is the reason I would shop with him again! If any business owner is willing to give you their personal number to ensure your order is fulfilled is A1 in my book! GO DAWGS!

text: Spectacular service, excellent clothing options from simple tuxedos to the more wild look.  Great prices and exceptional quality.  Will come back to evening out for any of my formal clothing needs!!

text: Professional, friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable are the best ways I can describe the staff at “Evening Out”. My groomsmen and myself went there and thanks to the staff over there we came out looking good. 5/5 stars, highly recommended !!

Men warehouse stereotype me and I will never return plus Evening out got better choice with best prices.

name: Karl Cody
text: I was going to go to men’s warehouse where I was expecting to pay between 200$ and 250$ for a tux rental. Instead found Evening Out and not only did they beat the price they shattered the price and my expectations.  If you are looking for a tux rental for yourself or a wedding party this is the place to go no questions asked.  The owner is extremely courteous and knowledgeable on all things tuxedos.  You will be glad you went to Evening Out Formal Wear!

name: Andrew Hamiter
text:
I purchased a shirt from this location and came back to exchange the shirt for a larger size without a receipt.  First, I was told that they do not return items that have been worn.  Moments later, the "manager" told me that they would buy it back for 50%.  I asked the "manager", "is it not true that you send shirts to the dry cleaners after they have been tried on?"  He replied, "yes".  I asked, "but, you can't take this shirt back and have it dry cleaned with the rest of them?"  He shook his head.  I asked for the manager and he said, "I am the manager".

they took my information and put it in the system when I purchased the shirt, so there is a record of my purchase.

The last experience that i will ever have with the store left a sour taste.  The sales staff, mainly the "manager", left me highly disappointed in their professionalism, honesty, and concern to make it right.  I drove to another location and they exchanged my item for a larger size without too much hassle.

My advice:  Go to another brand name store for quality service.  My friend, who is a former Jos A.
Bank employee, recommended that I take my future business to Brooks Brothers at the Summit.  I forward that advice to all of you.

Every time one of the men would go to get sized or pick up something, I was called and asked questions that were answered by simply looking at their computers. I felt like I was constantly just telling them how to do their job. Also, some of the suits still did not fit properly even after getting fitted. I would not recommend them to anyone!!

When I checked out the salesman wouldn't even look at me or make eye contact. It seems ridiculous to be so upset, but part of the reason I went to Jos. A. Bank was because I wanted knowledgable advice.

I do think the tie and socks I bought are nice, but next time I'll go somewhere else.

name: Carson Landers
text:
I normally don't do reviews, but I've had so many bad experience with three Jos. A. Banks stores that I'm going to go on an adventure. Here I go.

Part 1:
This particular store was the worst of all. My wife (now) and I walked in, walked up to an employee that was just standing there drinking a soda not doing anything, and told him that we were getting married - that we needed to buy 12 suits for their buy 1 get 3 free sale. That's right. 12 suits. He looks at us with a blank stare and just points off in the distance and says that we can look over there for some.

Later on, we get someone that actually knows how to communicate. He doesn't know how to fuit someone for a suit even though he tries but does horribly, but then he keeps running off to the first guy we walked up to to tell him sorry for taking his customer. We were never his customer to begin with.

My wife and I were completely stressed out after this. I could go on about other details, but in the end we walked out. We were going to buy 12 suits, but they couldn't care less. I haven't had this poor of service in a long time even though buying a suit is where customer service is supposed to be very important.

Meet me again in Part 2 at the Huntsville, AL Bridge Street store.

name: Y Liu
text:

resp.text:
Bryan,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Rest assured this will be addressed with the regional and store management team of our Birmingham, AL location for review and training purposes. We’d love to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you’d like to discuss this with us in greater detail, please email your preferred contact info and the best time to reach you to at JABListens@josabank.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
JAB Listens

name: Doug Zeiger
text: Our wedding was planned for May 2nd. Covid-19 became the reality and there was disaster after disaster. We cancelled, replanned, downsized, and resized to accommodate the changing world around us. At the start, I had expert advice and help from Ben who fashioned two outfits for the preceding parties. The styling, the fit, and the attention to detail was superb. If you like things done right, go to Shaia's. But the story continues, for the actual wedding day we had a tuxedo picked out that was being made in Italy. The factory had to shut down due to the virus and in the few weeks leading up to the wedding, I was facing quite the dilemma. Ben called me for a special appointment to come in and see what could be done from what was on hand at the store. Ben and Ken went far beyond the extra mile to make sure I was not only clothed for my wedding, but the tuxedo was classy, comfortable, and contained the right amount of original. I cannot recommend Shaia's any higher. There were even a few other minor disasters with needing a haircut and my brides' dress needing last minute alterations that we took to Ken because he just got things done. This is where you can truly see Ken's kindness. He helped us in a huge way during our time of need. Shaia's is a five star store from every angle thanks to a helpful, accommodating, and knowledgeable staff.

resp.text: Thanks Doug for your sincere review. Congratulations to you and your wife, we can't wait to see the photos.

name: James Crenshaw
text: Shaia's is a family owned men's clothing store that is unparalleled as far as service and selection. The store itself makes finding clothes/shoes fun and interactive, while the exceptional staff go out of their way to help you and ultimately build relationships which will last forever. My father first went to Shaia's in the early 1970's where he bought his first nice sports coat and has been a return customer since. The family atmosphere is one of a kind, and makes this store truly special.

name: Sam Willingham
text: How lucky Birmingham Alabama is to have Shaia's. They have the best selection of finer men's clothing short of Italy. Rarely do you find a store like this that treat's you like family. Do yourself a favor and check them out.

name: Tony Lombardo
text: Shaia's is the best men's clothing store with the best clothes and best staff.  The members of the sales staff never talk down to me. They always give me the dignity, sense of equality, and respect they give all their clients and customers.

name: Will R
text: I have visited shades for more than 60 years. They have always been top of the line and in clothing. They carry a wide variety to suit many customers.

name: Shawn David
text: My husband has only recently been interested in "nice clothes." He's known Ken Shaia for years but we've not shopped there regularly. I decided to take him there for his 50th birthday a couple of years ago. Not only did we have a great time, we got so many timeless pieces that my husband loves. I continue to shop there and build his wardrobe which is the beauty of shopping at Shaia's: nothing trendy; all classic, tailored pieces that make him feel like a million bucks. We can call Shaia's, describe an upcoming event, and they'll have the perfect ensemble put together when we get there or, better yet, something that will go perfectly with the pieces we've already bought. A great place!

name: George
text:
WOW! Absolutely positively the best shopping experience I have ever had. I have an athletic build and finding clothes that fit my physique is impossible. Well, until I met Greg Flowers. He was my consultant, and he gave me the most knowledgable, helpful & educational journey about properly fitting clothes, what a tailor can and cannot do, and how to layer elements together into a cohesive personal style that is all your own. Greg has in-depth knowledge of all the products in the store, how they fit, which brands flatter certain body types, how to build a cohesive wardrobe and what will look good on you in a way that fits your personal style. The atmosphere at the store is relaxing and makes shopping feel like you are strolling around at home chatting with very knowledge and suave friends.

After one visit I am a full convert. If you have trouble finding clothes that not only fit but also complement your very hard-earned physique, then do yourself a favor and go see Greg.

name: David Barry
text: I have shopped at Shaia's for over 15 years now and they have consistently provided a great shopping experience. Their service, attention to detail and alterations truly separate them from all others.

name: Carlos M. Fernandez
text:
UPDATE 6-11-21 This business is truly worthy of a ten (10) Star rating! Once again they have come through in a professional, technically competent, and competitively priced manner. I had the barrel of my 20 gauge shotgun cut down to the regulatory length for home defense (18.5") and it came out perfect. The weapon looks like it just came out of the box! Truly a professional and talented job by the resident gun smith's! Thank you to all. Your results may vary.

BREAK

Should be in the 10+ Star club! I was extremely impressed with my first interaction with your staff. Erin (Counter Lady) and Gerald (Gunsmith) pulled it together in a timely manner installing a P365 Safety Conversion Kit on my weapon. The work was done in minimal time resulting in me feeling much safer with 12+1 configuration. Customer service was without par, quality of the work was perfect and the pricing was very competitive. Wishing you guys the best in biz. Stay safe, be alert. Best. CMF sends...

name: Chris Knight
text:
I stopped in today to test fire a new mossberg 88 I picked up. Had a hard time finding ammo before I arrived, but they happened to have a couple boxes of ammo i could use.

The staff is friendly, courteous, and very informative. They take the time to explain what it takes to fire at the range with ease, and have a cushy waiting area to view a quick training video. The whole process was smooth and easy.

The range safety officers are well on their game. I felt safe the entire time on the range, and they were able to quickly explain the touch screen track interface, and further explaining that safety is a top priority.

I signed on for 30 minutes, and decided to fire my .40 before testing the shotgun. The touch screen interface has me sold on coming back to bullet and barrel. With just a click, the target goes the exact distance. Takes all the guesswork out of the experience.

I fired my pistol, and was pleased with the range itself. The design is new and clean. And with the RSOs keeping an eye on everything, it's a great environment to enjoy your firearms.

I tried the 88, and it performed beautifully. I added some extra cushion due to a shoulder injury. For those that would ask, you can't shoot bird shot here. But you can fire buck shot and slugs. But I'll tell you, it's fun firing a shotgun at this range.

Afterward I wandered around and struck up conversations with some of the staff, and showed me a selection for sale. I was impressed with the inventory, as well as pricing. I see myself buying my next firearm from here.

For me, it's a bit of a drive from Madison. But good business is where you find it, and Bullet and Barrel is my newest one stop shop for all things firearms. Plus, open on Sunday!

Dont take my word for it, stop in and check them out today! I'll be back soon, keep up the good work guys.

resp.text: Thank you for coming down! Please come back soon and....May the force be with you ;)

name: Karen Smith
text: State of the art range! The employees are always friendly and helpful - from the sales team to the RSOs! Everyone is very professional and committed to ensuring the safety of everyone who walks through the doors. I would absolutely recommend this place to any of my friends or family without hesitation!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please come back soon!

name: JonPaul Wise
text: I recently moved to Huntsville and wanted to find a new class 3 place to call my "local shop". This place is a perfect example of how to do things right, treated me like I was a long time customer right from the start and after just a few visits I feel like I've been coming here for years. Very veteran friendly and the facility is far beyond just a gun shop. I've lived in 8 cities over 5 states in the past 10 years and this place is on the top without a doubt!

name: Justin W (JdogAwesome)
text: Extremely well maintained and high quality range! The firearm rentals where great and the guns where in pristine condition! The range officers where super nice and helped us a ton as it was my first time using a pistol. Can't recommend this place enough!

name: Adrian Farrales
text: Bullet and Barrel is a great place! They have a wide selection of firearms and a very nice indoor range, but what I like most about this place is that they offer excellent classes relating to firearms. Jeff is one of the staff members there and he is a great teacher. The folks working at Bullet and Barrel are experts and they'll make sure you get everything right. If you're looking for instructional classes on anything related to firearms, then Bullet and Barrel is definitely the place!

name: Lynn Watts
text: Took the handgun cleaning class with Jeff.  It was very informative.  I learned how to disassemble, clean and reassemble a firearm.  The tip about the grease was especially good since I have trouble at times with pulling the slide.  Thanks for the exceptional training.

name: David Norg
text:
Needed my scope mounted on a new rifle.
Made the mistake of taking it to another popular local business to get it done. Clearly was not a professional installation.
Gerald with Bullet and Barrel reinstalled the scope and rings on the spot and did it right!
Great people and service!

name: Carrie Givens
text:
I just made the best investment today, my new Wilson combat edcx9l firearm and I love It. Jeff was extremely helpful and the experience was awesome. I just started taking classes, and Jeff made sure I knew everything that I needed to know about the firearm before I left. He was very patient, considerate, and knowledgeable. Thank you Jeff, you’re awesome!
- C T Davis

name: Marquiz Liner
text: Can’t recommend Bullet and Barrel enough! The staff is very knowledgeable and extremely helpful! The range is clean, well-maintained, and well-managed by the excellent RSOs. Everyone we’ve encountered has been super nice! If you’ve never been, I highly recommend you check them out! They’re awesome!

name: Telia Norg
text: Just had a scope remounted correctly.  Took to another gun shop and they apparently had no idea what they were doing. As soon as we showed the clerk the firearm he immediately knew what was wrong. This is our place from now on.  Thanks

name: Hilary Crimmins
text:
Nice clean and well ventilated facility.
But honestly it is overpriced, and has extremely long waits. Members get preference and can be observed jumping the line before non-members for range access. I've even had a staff member tell me that they only had 4 boxes of ammo left and would only sell to members.
Today we, two of us for one lane, arrived at 2:15pm and paid for 30 minutes on the range. We waited well over 2 hours and did not get our full 30 minutes because they were closing. It's not worth it.

resp.text: We totally understand the frustration. We were extremely busy today as I'm sure you saw! With everything going on in the firearm industry we are trying to do everything we can. But we do have members who pay a monthly fee and part of that benefit is jumping the line. Kind of like Disney! We would love for you to give us another opportunity. Please reach out to me, Louis, at 256-384-4867 and we will make sure you have a 5 star experience

name: Joyce Maxwell
text: Had a wonderful experience Saturday with my daughter's. Took a class with Tommy, can't say enough about his wonderful teaching skills. We were nervous but with Tommy's great personality it wasn't long till we were calm and enjoying ourselves. Thank you so very much. We'll definitely be back!!

name: Andrew Emmerton
text: I took a private lesson with Jeff and he was very knowledgeable, I highly recommend taking a lesson. The rest of the staff were also great and they have a great selection of firearms for sale as well as some to rent for their indoor range.

name: Chad Jones
text: Louis and the crew at bullet and Barrel are first rate and so is their facility.  I've had some minor gunsmithing done as well, mainly to check suppressor alignment and get a few breaks lockset on, service has been fast and very affordable.  I've had a few problematic firearms inspected as well and John, their gunsmith, has always been straight forward and accurate.  Of the range facilities in the area, BnB stands head and shoulders above the rest.  I have range passes to go to other ranges for free, but I would rather spend some money at BnB to be with a better crowd and make sure their level of commitment to the average gun owner is rewarded.  When it comes to stores that are in your corner as a gun owner, these guys are bar none best of the best in our area.

name: pauline bracken
text: Sarah did a fantastic job teaching me how to firearm! I actually would give her 10 ⭐️ Since I haven’t in years!! I probably will take another class before I actually buy a pistol! Thank you again for your patience and spending over 2 hours with me! I had a wonderful time!!

name: Catherine Stower
text: Sarah was a wonderful instructor!  Her patience went above and beyond what I would have expected from an instructor, and her knowledge is tremendous.  In addition, she is continuing to work with me to help me figure out the best firearm for personal use.

name: Steven Gaffin
text:
I went because I was having the hardest time removing the retaining pin from the firing pin of my Remington 870. So I took the bolt down to Bullet and Barrel. Front Desk (not really front more like back left corner) staff was very welcoming and friendly. The gunsmith was able to remove the pin and lathe down a manufacturing defect in it that was keeping it in the bolt.
I was very satisfied and impressed with Bullet and Barrel and will definitely return for the many other services they offer.

text: Took a beginner's gun safety class.  Sarah was my instructor and was extremely knowlegeable.  She answered all my questions and gave me good advise on how to properly handle a fire arm.  She provided helpful hints on the firing range.  I plan on meeting with her again for more instruction.

text: Excellent instruction and advice from Jeff White! He is extremely knowledgeable and taught me a ton of tips to correct my technique. Thank you so much! It's just a great facility. Clean, professional, helpful.

name: Ethan Brewer
text: Alberto is the man. Great customer service. We talked about many different guns. He knew the product, and I could tell he was genuinely trying to help me.

name: Eugene Mayo
text: My first visit to Bullet & Barrel was a very pleasant experience. I expected the normal indoor gun range with no frills and a lack of management personnel for the amount of customers. Not at Bullet & Barrel! You enter the establishment and find yourself in a first class gun store with very tastefully displayed products. When you check in to the range most of the paper work is done electronically and there are plenty of well trained staff on hand to help you, not only at check in but on the range also. Defiantly not a Mom & Pops business. Top notch!

name: J Cowan
text: Great place for learning how to shoot or just for practice. My husband and I visited and enjoyed it. Truly learned at lot from our instructor Sarah. She was very knowledgeable and very patient. We learned so much. She walked through every detail with us together and separately, as we each own two different guns. Highly recommend! Thank you Sarah!! We will be back.

name: Dorothy Loftin
text: Thank you Tim for a great lesson on learning to get comfortable with a gun! I was with my sister and friend, both of whom had experience with guns.  Tim tailored the class for all 3 of us with varying abilities.  I had never touched a gun and was shooting with multiple guns by the end of the session.  The best part of it all is now I’m comfortable with the gun we have in our home.  Thanks again Tim!  We will definitely be back for more lessons!

name: Randy Chavez
text: Went in the is morning for the first time to sight in my hunting rifles. WOW!  Got hooked up with George and he did it all. Helped me sight in four rifles is one hour, explained everything he was adjusting and just made the experience unbelievable. Couldn't have asked for anything more. Thanks George!

text: My twins took the Youth Marksmanship Class  with Sarah as part of their 13th bday weekend. She was amazing! She was so patient with the group of kids. She explained everything very well and made sure the class understood all the points of gun safety and operation which allowed them to have an amazing time once they got the hands on experience on the range. My twins DID NOT want to leave.  We will definitely be back!

resp.text: Thank you do much!!! Sarah is a great instructor! Please come visit us again soon!

text: Best range in Huntsville.... and it’s not even close. I became a member when they were still building it because I knew it would be a great place and they have exceeded my expectations. The ranges are well lit and spotless. The thickness of the barriers between the ranges was a major selling point to me. I feel safe and secure when I am on my lane. The range masters are helpful and add another layer of protection for the customers/ members that are throwing lead at a target. I strongly suggest you give Bullet and Barrel a shot (pun intended) if you are looking for a place to shoot. Beware, this place can become addictive.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words! We appreciate your continued support

text: A friend and I took the first steps class from instructor Sarah.  Sarah gave great instruction emphasizing safety first.  She was very patient.  I learned A lot and will go back in the future.  Also the facility was very clean.

text: If you’ve heard about this place and have not stop by, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? This place is awesome! It’s clean, and there’s safety videos which made me feel safe and my favorite part was that the staff made me feel comfortable. I encountered Sarah who is so patient and knowledgeable. This was my first time using my new .380 and she encouraged me to practice more with it and not be discouraged. Just when I thought the place couldn’t get any better I even had the same experience as I exited by Pam she’s so sweet she explained to me about how to become a member. This place sells everything too!

I dropped my gun off with new scope John amd Alberto had all the necessary mounting hardware in stock.  1 hour they mounted ,bore sighted and zeroed in at there 100 yard range. EXCELLENT SERVICE and very well trained gun smith and employees.

text: Got a membership to this place and its worth every penny. Excellent range officers and all very professional. The ranges themselves are very clean and ventilated. Once you shoot here you won't go anywhere else again.

resp.text: Thank so much! We appreciate you joining the family!

name: braxton guthrie
text: Extremely respectful over the phone was very refreshing, normally because of my age (21) I'm in between being treated as an adult and an adult.

name: david schachle
text: If you are looking to learn how to shoot, I highly reccomend Jeff. He is very nice and profesional. They have a clean range and store. Very fun experience.

name: Bryson Hill
text:
After going to three other places in Huntsville and the big box store across from Bridge street that has the street named after them along with there sales add and waiting in line for hour two find out that they did not have one or ever had one.
For now on Bullet and Barrel has my business best prices in town Thomas was my sales person he was a great help . Everyone was very nice I encourage anyone that is in the market for firearm visit Bullet and Barrel

name: donald reimer
text: Very clean, safe and very nice range people are very helpful and friendly no attitude will definitely return when back in town

resp.text: Come back and see us! Travel safe

name: Charles Pruitt
text: The staff is friendly and knowledgeable, and the gun range is awesome. Whether you're a beginner or a pro, if you're looking for a place to shoot, try them out. They've definitely earned my business.

name: Galvin Freeman
text: First visit here to shoot and I was very, very impressed with the entire staff from start to finish! This place has that it factor and has lots of potential to become a gem here in Huntsville! The indoor range takes it to another level. Definitely recommend checking this place out! You won't be disappointed! I enjoyed my visit and will be back.

resp.text: Please come back soon!

name: J B
text:
First, I must say that the range facilities are quite nice with helpful staff. The range facilities are up to date, very comfortable and the RSOs are very professional.

However, I made the mistake of using the gunsmith services. This has not gone well. This particular saga has been going on since the end of November. I always had to call or email them to get any status and the answer was always the same...it will be ready Saturday, it will be ready next week, it will be ready "sometime next week". I do not believe that they have devoted any significant time to my project. The first time I checked in with them after a week, that is when they informed me I needed to bring in other components. They never reached out to me. Very frustrating. Now that it is in Jan I have given up working with them and I am now taking the project somewhere else.

I get the feeling that they want to work on things when they feel like it, have no obligation to provide status or time estimate to the customer. Furthermore, I do not believe that they have fulltime gunsmiths which feels a little misleading from the website.

So if any readers know a professional, hardworking gunsmith in the area I am certainly looking!

resp.text: Hey JB! we're so sorry this was your experience. Normally our Gunsmiths can offer quick turn around times. Some thing may change that with parts availability and waiting on other parts we need from our customers. I am sorry we were back logged at the time and when we received your receiver in late December we began to diagnose the problem. But again that's no excuse for a lack of communication. Please let us know if we can be of further assistance

name: Andre Harris II
text:
Went to buy a light for my handgun and I received quick and friendly service. I was also lucky enough to receive a small discount while I was there.
Clean and an open environment also

name: Ethan Owens
text: A truly epic indoor shooting range. Truly the best in Alabama. Seriously. Plus I don’t have to worry about lead poisoning or negligent discharges by employees. They’re prices are really decent as well. Not the cheapest but well worth the price because of the great value they represent.

name: Sara Bozeman
text: Jerrell, the gunsmith, literally saved my weekend. I went in on a Friday needing to sight in a new rifle before going hunting for the weekend. My mounts were machines improperly and couldn’t hold a zero. Jerrell skipped his lunch to fix my mounts, and did an amazing job. The rest of the staff was very helpful, kind, and generous with advice. I love how clean and fresh the facilities are as well. Not many gun ranges are so well kept! I’ll be going back, and definitely using Jerrell for any work I need done on a gun.

resp.text: We love our gunsmiths!!! Please come back and see ya soon!  😀

name: Kenyon Stone
text: Such a great place! Staff very helpful and friendly. Brought a 12 year old, they had some options for her, and were making sure she enjoyed herself as well. Tim was a great help, felt very welcome

name: Caitlin Thomas
text: Such an enjoyable experience.  Highly recommend Bullet & Barrel

name: Destiny Freeman
text: We had such a great time here! Friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive staff. The range and facilities are very well maintained and clean. Wonderful range and personable people. Win win. Thank you!

name: DAN From the SOUTH
text: This is by far my favorite shooting range to use in Huntsville! Very friendly environment and extremely kid friendly. My son always says "Bullet and Barrel" when I ask him where he wants to go!! Well done guys!

resp.text: Thanks!!!! We like to think we're all a big family 😀😀😀

name: Matt Ray
text: No better place in Huntsville to buy a silencer.  You can even use it in the range while waiting on the government.  Silencer shop kiosk makes the process super simple, and the staff are excellent to work with.

resp.text: Thank you so much!

name: Mike K
text: I took Louis up on his offer of a tour of Bullet and Barrel as my previous experience was less than stellar.  The experience this time was quite the opposite of my last visit; even before I met Louis.  I was greeted as soon as I entered the building and was pointed in the right direction to meet Louis.  The tour was thorough, and as suspected the facilities are top notch, and they offered quite a bit more than I expected.  The gun range is state of the art and the RSO's are extremely helpful.  The staff is friendly, professional and quite knowledgeable .  Thank you Louis, and the entire Bullet and Barrel staff for an exceptional experience.  I most definitely will be back.

resp.text: Mike, I am so sorry that this is what you experienced with us today. We pride ourselves on giving our customers an awesome experience. As our reviews reflect that this is not our norm. But I'd love to personally invite you back and I'll give you a behind the scenes tour of our facility. Thank you for the feedback and we truly hope we can deliver a 5-star response on you next visit. If you'd like to set this up my personal email is louis@bulletandbarrel.com~ Louis, General Manager

name: Rick Morgan
text:
Jason did an excellent job teaching me how to shoot. He caught and corrected all my aiming problems.
A really great teacher!

name: Thomas Webber
text: I have been to Bullet and Barrel many times. Always a great time and the staff treat you right. Best place in Huntsville!!!

name: Danta Simonsen
text: My son and I took a gun safety class and had a great time. The instructors were knowledgeable and made the class fun without loosing the seriousness of what we were there to learn. Tim took extra time to help my son making him feel confident. He was very encouraging no matter how bad my aim was. Excellent service, great facilitie. Highly recommend.

name: Michael Mauro
text: Hands down, the best Gun Range I've ever visited. I've lived across 5 states and have visited ranges in each one. This one has, by far, exceeded my expectations in all areas. The staff are immensely helpful, friendly and professional. Thank you for your clean facility and expert staff!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words!!!! And for bringing us some cool guns to work on~louis

name: Bridgette Bradley
text: We had our corporate event here. The employees were simply wonderful! Everyone was very knowledgeable and cared about each person in attendance. The facility is immaculate! The shooting range itself is the best in Huntsville. Highly recommend Bullet and Barrel!!

name: Jacob Boyett
text: Went in as a newbie shooter and within 2 minutes of being in the range Dave stepped up and immediately told me things I could correct and even went so far as to give me some drills to run. I would recommend Dave and B&B to anybody. See you guys next week!

name: Barrett Eimer
text: Great range to shoot at with nice lanes and technology; they have a decent selection of quality guns and rifles too. They also sell apparel for men and women.  It comes together as a welcome and unique blend of ideas for a place to shop.  There is a ton of space and it will be cool to see how they intend to make use of it all.

name: Weston Hall
text: What a fun professional place! Very clean and the staff was very friendly. They weren’t intimidating and was nice when I asked them questions.

resp.text: Thank you so much! Please visit us again soon!!

name: Ira Merritt
text: I have used the range at B&B  a number of times and the staff is always friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and safety conscious. I also recently did a trade and had gun smithing done on an AR. My interactions have all been very satisfactory. John, the gunsmith, and others went far out of their way to resolve a non-standard hardware problem in a way that I greatly appreciated. Great staff and operation.

name: Jay Graham
text: My wife and I shot guns for the first time. We had an excellent experience. We took a personal class from Colt, a fantastic instructor! He is very knowledgeable, explains things clearly, and kept us feeling confident throughout the entire process. We're already looking forward to our next visit.

name: Miki Heaton
text: First time to visit this range, very nice facility and clean well maintained range. I would have given it 5 stars if not for two things. When we walked in the door two employees behind the counter were on their cell phones and didn’t look up until we spoke. Then when we walked on the range the range officer was also on his phone. In each case neither were talking only looking at the screen.  I personally have a problem with employees being on their phones at work but on a firing range just seems like a really bad idea.

name: Will Booker
text: I drove all the way across town to get there still in line for 5-10 minutes they let two people in front of me go on to the range and then told me that they just took the last person on the range and turned me away. It wasn't covered related because they weren't busy. I won't be going back thanks for nothing

resp.text: Thank for leaving this feedback! As you can see typically the strong majority of our guests have 5 star experiences. Talking this over with our team we looked back at your trip. We do have a pretty firm rule on not allowing shooters on the range 30 minutes before we close. The folks who went ahead of you are some of our members and one of their perks is lane priority. We would absolutely love for you to give us another chance and I would like to invite you back as my guest and comp you your range time. ~Louis S.

name: Matt White
text: I am so happy with the experience I had shopping for my gun parts and my new purchase of the noveske space invader! They have answered every question that I have had. I usually give a name to ask for but theres no need in this best gun/shooting range in north alabama! Everyone is very knowledgeable. This place is amazing!

name: Matt Hamblin
text: Great staff and an amazing range. Oozes professionalism and safety. Highly recommended!

resp.text: Thank you so much! Come visit us again soon

name: Ariel Eisenstadt
text: Lots of fun, friendly staff very helpful. Terrific selection of rental firearms very fair pricing

resp.text: Thank you so much for the kind words! Please come visit us again soon and if there is anything we can do please let us know~Louis

name: Pat Shores
text: Great place to shoot!  Awesome service and staff especially the range officers.  They were both friendly and helpful all while being professional.  This was my first trip but it sure won’t be my last!

name: Seth Webb
text: These is the best range in North AL. The range is well lit, climate controlled, and each lane is very spacious. But the best part are the people who work here. I cannot give enough praise for my favorite place in Huntsville.

name: Ron Volinski
text: First time at a gun range. The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Very nice place and the people are friendly and attentive.  Jason was really great with helping me with gun control and site alignment.  Great experience!

name: Caleb Hollingsworth
text: Never thought I would go to an indoor range again after a poor experience at Larry's range. The range here is nice and well lighted! Love it!

resp.text: Thank you! Come visit during the holidays!

name: tim watson
text: Nice and friendly staff. Clean and well run. Will definitely go there again.

resp.text: Thank you so much!!! Merry Christmas and we look forward to seeing you soon

name: alfred keely
text: The facilities are very nice, clean,  and comfortable. The staff are also very nice, and knowledgeable. It was an outstanding experience. My wife and I will be back.

name: Tom Copeland
text: Great place.Great people. Wouldn't think of going anywhere else.

name: Wayne Roddy
text: This a real nice place. The staff is very friendly, the decor and range is super clean.

resp.text: Thank you so much Wayne!!! Please come back soon

name: Mandi Harbour
text: Me && my husband went today and talked with a guy name Jeff. Let’s just say we WILL NOT be going back. He was rude and his costumer service was trash 🗑 this place won’t last long at all with the prices and the non friendly staff such as Jeff!

resp.text: I do apologise that this was your experience! This is so strange to hear because Jeff is one of our most lauded employees. Although we do apologise that we didn't meet your expectations I'd love to discuss your experience. Please call me on Tuesday at 256-384-4867 ~Louis GM

name: Jack Stripling
text: This place is awesome! Loved the rifle range. Great experience. I'll be back!

name: Anthony Williams
text: Came in looking for a gun that they had out of stock. One of the workers really helped me  out by looking for the weapon at other stores. Then helped me understand the paper work process. One thing that stuck out to me was friendly customer service and needs of the consumer met.

name: Louisa G
text: State of the art facility.  Super friendly and comfortable environment.

name: Paige Burchel
text: Precious ladies items - jackets, tees, hats, scarves, etc...not to be missed!

resp.text: Come again! We have a great sale going on!

text: You range does include a 100 yard range. However, put the fact that it is CLOSED ON MONDAYS on you site!!!  What a waste of time!

resp.text: Jason I am so sorry for the inconvenience. We are closed on Mondays so we can keep Bullet and Barrel to our high standard of a clean and safe range. However we do have our hours posted on our Website as well as here on Google and Facebook. But please come in tomorrow and we'll give you a 5 star experience

name: DM M (DMM)

name: Susan Hoskins

name: Charlie Donner

name: Taylor Means
text: Who likes to shop for dress clothes? Not I. But sometimes it has to be done.  You simply can’t beat the price, selection, and service here. We needed suits for 7 guys in a hurry and Casey took care of us, going over and beyond. We were in and out fast. Quality product, excellent section, and top-notch customer service. I live at the beach so don’t wear fancy stuff often, but whenever I do, BB in Foley will be the go-to. Thanks Casey!

name: Ryan Dallett
text: Great deals! Thank you for the military discount!

name: Shelby Adkison
text: We took advantage of the great specials and bought my husband a whole new wardrobe. Excellent customer and sales service! We had so much fun shopping. The ladies were so funny and engaging. We had such a lovely time.

text: Came in to purchase items for my brother and dad. There was only one other customer in the store. There was an older lady not doing much and a man assisting the only other customer. I was in there for a while and was never greeted or asked if I needed help. I felt like I was being stereotyped. Little did they know, my budget to spend was no less than 1k. I walked out after ten or more minutes of not being spoken to. My dad has several BB items but after this experience, I will never shop with them again. I made a special trip to the store because there is not one where I live. I'd give zero stars if possible.

name: Dani Cakes
text:
My son, who is kind of shy, had a school dance coming up so we were in need of a suit. We didn’t know where to start and neither my son nor I had any confidence in what to even look at.
When we walked in, Malcolm headed straight for us and instantly took us under his wing. He patiently spent close to an hour helping my son find the right fit, the right color (for his skin tone) and to match his date’s dress. We found everything we needed except for the tie. We were so very pleased with the purchase we made. But the most important thing we left with, was my son’s confidence! Malcolm told my son “to stand up straight, lift your head up, and be confident in the good looking guy that he is”
As a mom, to a shy teenage boy,  this means the world to me!
When we left to go find the tie at a different store, we were totally lost again. My son said “mom, do you think we can go get Malcolm to help us?” They may not ever see each other again but this guy with the exceptional customer service skills made a LIFELONG impact on my son. Express, I hope you realize how great of an employee you have in Malcolm. I wish the world was filled with more Malcolms.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing what an awesome experience you had with the team at the Bel Air Mall EXPRESS. We forwarded your feedback to the District Manager so that they know what a special time you all had in the store. If you should have any additional questions, feel free to reach us at 1-888-397-1980.

This is not the place I want to give my money too.

resp.text: Thank you for reaching out and sharing your feedback with us! We'll make sure we pass that along to the appropriate department.

name: Angenette Peterson
text: Love this store. The employees are professional, helpful and friendly. They know me by name. Lol. I found a dress to where to my son's graduration and a concert. My sons love the jackets and jeans i buy here or order on line.

name: Angela Shetlin
text: Love their clothing

name: Matthew Thames
text:
I’m an official Auburn nut, and if your like me…this is your place!

They have a lot of great items at great prices! Very nice staff, highly recommended!

resp.text: Matthew, thanks so much for shopping at Alumni Hall and the kind words. We hope to see you again soon!

name: Jim Hawkins
text: I probably spend 1000.00 a year in this store but I have spent my last dime.  I purchased 4 sweatshirts for my wife at Christmas.  We were out of town at Christmas and of the 4 there was 1 that she did not want.  Because of Covid concerns and some personal issues I was not able to bring the item back for a refund untill today.  While the young man was very nice, he stated that I had waited too long to return this item and that "they" would not allow him to scan the barcode for the refund.  Now I understand this to a point but I am sure that this could have been handled and that I could have recieved my refund.  I would expect a little understanding after the last year we have all had.  This is only a $60.00 item and I can assure you that I will be taking the other $940.00 that I would have spent at Alumni Hall this year to another local store.  I assure you that J&M would have honored my request.  I hope the owner is ok with this loss in potential income for a $60.00 refund.

resp.text:
Hi Jim, we are sorry to hear about your experience at our store in Auburn. We did speak with our staff about this situation. We appreciate you being a loyal customer with us, but we do however have a return policy that our store must abide by. We did extend our return policy to January 1, 2021 due to the pandemic, but it has since returned to the 30 day standard. Normally our return policy is only 30 days after purchase. The return also must be put back on the original form of payment which our staff said you no longer had. We would be happy to offer you a gift card or have your next online order shipping on us. We do value your business. If you wish to receive a gift card or free shipping, email marketing@alumnihallstores.com.

https://www.alumnihall.com/info/returns

text: Need a barber?  Go see my man Berto.  Dude is awesome. Haven’t purchased clothing there yet but all the employees are genuinely nice.  Cool little shop.

name: Eric Jackson
text: Superb place to get high quality men's clothing. Bought a bespoke suit here. Very pleased

name: Matt Colontrelle
text: Awesome haircut, exactly what I wanted! Great beard trims too! Clean lines, great atmosphere, easy to work with and top notch service. First time using him and I won’t be going anywhere else, he’ll be my sons new barber too!

name: Chris Gaddes
text: David was tremendously helpful! I will definitely be returning.

name: Marcos Almonte Perez
text: Amazing Men's store in the heart of Huntsville. Quality clothing and shoes. Specialty: Custom made Suits. Barber on site is a major plus. Berto is the best! Love getting my cut and beard trim there as well as shopping.

name: Kayla Shipman
text: An amazing mens store in the heart of Downtown Huntsville, Roosevelt & Company has everything you need! (They even have an on site barber which is so fabulous!) My husband is quite tall and always has a hard time finding the right length in a pant and has even had a few custom made when needed! Plus, the staff is so helpful and friendly! Huntsville needed this gorgeous, classic men's store!

name: Brant Myers
text: Roberto is an amazing barber. I highly recommend him. He always make my beard look fantastic.

name: Andrew Hall
text: After a frustrating fit experience at Men’s Warehouse (I guess they just don’t make suits for guys with broad shoulders and a trim waist), I came in to Roosevelt and Co. and Christopher got me into a great fitting and handsome suit, with a matching tailored dress shirt. Excellent service, clothes fit great, great quality. I was expecting exorbitant prices, but I was upfront about my budget and I was pleasantly surprised.

name: Scott Guffey
text:
This review is for the barber Berto! He was exactly what I was looking for while in town visiting family. I had an idea what I wanted and he went beyond my expectations. Got a new haircut, beard trim and he even does nose and ear waxing! Something I don’t find too often in town at other barbers.
Definitely try him out. He’s got a great energy and skills to back it up.

name: Andrew Mason
text: A review for Berto. Awesome haircut and great conversation. It’s just one chair here so it’s a really chill atmosphere not like a salon. Would recommend!

name: Emily Rogers
text: Great spot for middle to high-end clothing and accessories for the guys in your life. The space is beautiful and airy while feeling grounded and timeless. We don't purchase a lot here as it's a little beyond our budget but we love visiting and the staff is super friendly regardless of your purchase history or intentions to browse/buy/kill time. Support this place if you can!

name: Andre Hinds
text: Roosevelt and his team are incredibly helpful and polite. They will go the extra mile to ensure everything you buy suits you perfectly. The store has an upscale relaxed style that is fitting for their motif. They also have a full service barber on staff to make sure you look absolutely perfect in every sense of the word. I couldn't recommend any store more highly.

name: Taylor Von Terror Pinup
text: Wonderful store. They carry top of the line clothing for men, accessories and hygiene products. Service is friendly and helpful. They have a barber on site as well. Cody the Barber is super talented has outstanding customer service and carries the traditions of a classic barber.

name: Gbadebo Odutola
text: Easily the best menswear store in Huntsville with absolutely the best customer service I've experienced in the entire city. When the owner remembers your name and hasn't seen you in months, that's what you're looking for! The clothes, shoes, and accessories are all excellent quality, unique, and look amazing. If there's one menswear store in Huntsville that deserves your support...it's easily Roosevelt's

name: Jim Williams
text: Quality products and customer service at their finest. Great store, great clothes, amazing staff. The ideal sartorial retail experience - a perfect combination of modern edge and sophistication, paired with the steadfast southern tradition of clothing and hospitality. The must-visit men's store in Madison County.

name: Trent Thomas
text: Roosevelt & Co is a true gem of the rarest kind.  The selection of men's clothing, shoes and accessories is top knotch and the service excellent. Huntsville is really lucky to have them here.

name: Tracy Reynolds
text: Most amazing men's store in Huntsville! Staff are very knowledgeable about fashion and they have an awesome selection of current clothes...

name: Eric St. John
text: Great selection, great people and a cool experience. Lucky to have this in Huntsville and downtown at that! Highly recommend!

name: Colin Brooks

text: A great,  upscale men's clothing store.   Roosevelt and the rest of the crew are friendly and knowledgeable about their products.

name: Gregory Jones

text: We went here today to do the dreaded Jean shopping, only this time it wasn’t a dreadful experience at all!! name: matt m.
text:
As a male I get the impression that females that work there (Keep in mind there was no indication of any male employees in sight) seem to dislike men and attempt to discourage them from applying and working there. Certainly not an all inclusive environment as every company tries to promote themselves as today and one makes no illusions from the moment you walk through the door. The first female employee I encountered attempted to discourage me from applying by saying that she didn’t think there were any positions open when I had already checked online and the company website did indicate that there were positions available. She suddenly changed her tune when I told her I had seen this.

Time and place is a strange phenomena. Different time, different place I’d be willing to bet these same females would have no problem themselves with complaining about inclusion and equality if the same situation were reversed.

P.S. It’s not too prophetic on my part to now state what the obvious will be. Once the store manager comes upon this review, mark my words, ( As an agent of the company and for the companies behalf, and by proxy for their own self preservation) she will surely state how she did tell me that their was a position open but it wasn’t very many hours, and that I am welcome to file an application because it is an all inclusive company that does not discriminate. Unfortunately that only goes so far and becomes the venerable “lip service”; And at different stores, in different places it may very well be an all inclusive company, but not here at this one.

I am very shocked, because before this incident I did not have anything bad to say about this store at the Summit. Buy your Lucky Brand Jeans at Belk. name: Niky Li
text: Horrible experience! The staff wouldn’t let me purchase shoes because they claimed I had already been there earlier that day. I usually NEVER set foot in Finish Line. I have 0 points on my rewards. They also claimed they had footage of me on their security cameras but couldn’t show proof of it. They lied about the shoes they had in stock. I was offered one size, but after some discussion in the back, the staff told me that size wasn’t available anymore and i couldn’t purchase anything because of my “previous visit that morning.” I can’t believe the staff lied and would not let a buying customer purchase from this store, just so they can keep the shoes for themselves!!

name: Chelsea Williams
text: Placed an order online to pick up in store. Received confirmation email but no other communications about pickup. Called customer service to cancel the order after 3 days of hearing nothing and they said I had to call the store. Called this store & they said my order had “already been processed out as if were picked up on accident .” I asked them to go ahead & cancel the order anyway since I clearly had not come to pick it up. They said they would have to see my ID in store to process the cancellation . I asked why no ID was needed to “process it out” to begin with & they said it was a mistake. I asked what happens if I don’t pick up the shoes, thinking they would have to automatically issue the refund, and these people said the shoes would just sit there since their system shows that I had paid & picked them up. They refused to cancel my order & insisted I had to show them my ID to get my money back. Customer service determined that  was A LIE!!! Had to call customer service back & get them to call this store just to get my money back. Terrible customer service. Never shopping here again.

name: Jacob Li
text: Horrible staff. My cousins and I went to buy some Jordan’s at the Finishline in Dothan, Alabama. They let me check out and they then went to get a size 11 for my cousin but then came back to tell us that another employee claimed that he already saw us here earlier this morning. Not only did they refuse show any proof (cameras) that we were here, they were rude and it didn’t seem like they cared. After that, I told my brother to come and get the size 11 for my cousin. They then said that every size had been raffled off and that only size 8 was available! I’m 100% sure that they planned on backdooring the pairs for themselves or to resell. Why would a shoe store manager refuse to sell shoes to customers and lie, claiming that we were here earlier but we all rode in the same car. This is most definitely the shopping worst experience I’ve ever had.

name: Kevin Li

name: Kira Lunsford
text: if i could rate this store zero stars i would.. this place is terrible do not go here the staff is mean as hell. Just a quick story so you can get an idea of how they are here.. I remember one day i went there and the store wasn't set up to close till 2 hours later and there was no sign on the door saying they were closed. So i thought it was fine to shop there.. oh but was i wrong...  so i walked up to the door and tried to open it ( mind you the lights are on and i see employees in there. As soon as i tried to open the door they hurried and turned off the lights and ducked as if i didn't see them... so unprofessional and inappropriate. When i came back a week or two later the lady at the cash register when i brought it up acted as if she didn't know what happened. what a disappointment.

text: The older lady is super rude! I almost walked out and said I would sell my clothes somewhere else. Shoot I’ll even spend the time to poshmark my items. I will not be back!

name: Tori O'Bryan
text: No one greeted me when I walked in the store. The girl at the cash register seemed extremely upset that I was dropping off clothes. An older lady told me I have to come back in an hour and they will not call me to remind me. Which is totally fine, but the way she said it was rude. When I came back to receive the offer of cash or store credit the same girl at the register mumbled the offer and I couldn’t hear her. I asked her to repeat, and she said it with even more of an attitude than the first time. She told me what they didn’t accept I could pick up “over there” not giving any instruction on where that would be. My husband and I walked around the counter looking for my items and could not find them. We asked her, “where are they?” And she acted like she didn’t hear us. So we just left. Whatever they didn’t take, they can have. Extremely unprofessional and I will not be back or recommend anyone else to do business with this company.

name: Bay Wilk
text: I went to this place today. Found a cute dress and wanted to get it,  but there was a hole in it they were unaware of. I asked if she could take less for it, she said no not without managment.  I finished shopping and was fixing to ask her is there any way she could call her manager and ask, since I live in Florida and couldn't come back if she would take extra off, and before I could finish my sentence when I was at in there any way, she cut me off abruptly and said NO MAAM I CANNOT.  I was rather shocked. She clearly was rude, didn't listen and could care less. The manager is Kim and I plan to let her know. This was about 430pm.  If you want better customer service  and cheaper prices go to the one over by walmart at the north end. It's much better.

name: Brittney Pettis
text: I wanted to sell some items before leaving town, so I took a basket full of clothes over on a Thursday afternoon at 4:30 PM and the girl behind the counter told me they weren’t buying clothes anymore that day because the (1?) person that buys had left already, so I had to leave my basket until I got back into town one Saturday. When I got to the store on Saturday around 5:45 PM two girls were behind the counter. I gave them my name and they pulled two items out of a black bin and I inquired about the whereabouts of my basket and the other clothes. The girl replied, “they’re over there,” and asked the other girl behind the counter to process my buy so she could go be on her phone. Once the buy was processed and I got my money, I waited a few minutes for one of them to get my items they didn’t buy. They didn’t, so I asked if I could have my basket. The girl who was on her phone said ambiguously, “they’re over there,” and pointed haphazardly towards a wall and went back to her phone. I found my items and left. This customer service is unacceptable and disappointing. I’ll be taking my business to Plato’s.

text: This place is a joke! I went in to sell some lightly used and some new boutique clothing and a few designer purses (one that has never been used) and left the store with nothing to show for it. The service was disgraceful, and the blonde lady said I had a lot of children's clothing and we only had 2-3 articles out of about 40. They tried to give us $5 for two designer purses (one of which are was over $100 and never been used.) Would not recommend to my worst enemy. If I could I would give below a one star.

resp.text: I do believe you are just unhappy because we  didn't offer u any money, we pulled your sheet that u fill in upon arrival , only one or two adult items, that we couldn't use, we buy all day long until 6 pm, on the things that sell in the store, sorry that u have such a bad experience in the buying process, we also have a big MOST WANTED board in the store

name: Keegan Williamson
text:
I can't believe all the negative reviews I'm seeing. Uptown is bar none, the best place in Dothan, or the tri-county area, to buy men's clothing. When I first moved to the area I immediately went to Plato's Closet to see what the Dothan branch had to offer, the short version is, not much. After going to Plato's several times in a 90 day time period and never finding anything of merit, a co-worker took me to Uptown Cheapskate one day before work. That's when it all made sense. The reason Plato's Closet was completely barren was because everybody went to Uptown, and I'm all for it because their price is easily half of what Plato's would charge and their selection is vastly superior.

I would also like to point out that the owner of Uptown has never been anything but extremely accommodating, courteous, and immensely helpful. If you don't like the value she gives you're clothing or accessories the solution is quite simple, shop elsewhere! As for me, when I'm able to not only buy two pairs of Bullhead pants(the clothing line has been discontinued since Pac-Sun went under and has become like finding a needle in a haystack) but also a beautiful yellow and blue Ralph Lauren cardigan, all for less than $30!? I know better than to look a gift horse in the mouth.

Truly leagues above their so called competition.

resp.text: thanks

They seem annoyed every time someone walks in. The customer service is not great at all, will not be returning.
