name: Chuck Missildine
text: Very clean establishment. I literally did not see one piece of paper or similar debris on the floor. Shelves were nicely organized with price tags, clearance racks and store personel easy to find. Everyone (employees and customers alike) was wearing their masks and following social distancing guidelines which made the whole experience even more pleasant since I was shopping with several friends including my one year old great niece and a lifelong friend who has an extremely compromised  immune system from struggles with Crohn's disease. Scored a ton of bargains on name brands and designer's fashions. Seriously, I got my great niece a pair of sneakers and a pair of adorable boots for only $2 each. By the way, they were made by none other than the legendary JUICY COUTURE. I would have had to shell out another $45-$65 if I had purchased these designer's labels from elsewhere.  I felt practically criminal after swiping a game carrying case plus a glass screen protector (two separate items) for my son's NINTENDO SWITCH. I paid $5 for both which saved me about $15 and earned me HUGE POINTS with my son. How about this bit of awesomeness: $3 for Beyonce Pulse perfume, 3.4 ounce bottle, normally $15 or more. I also grabbed 2 hoodies for $1 each. And whatever you do, do NOT get me started on the huge savings and discounts I racked up on for the rest of the clothing that I bought as an early birthday present to myself.

name: Becky Duckett
text: Old Navy=BAD NEWS.  BIG red signs on doors and windows say "50% Off Everything", so I decided to purchase overpriced face masks.  I got to the counter with 2 packages and found out that "masks are excluded".  Although not happy, I decided to go ahead and purchase for the sake of supporting local retailers.  Within 5 minutes, I discovered that the masks are only one layer of fabric, so I went back to return them. After waiting in line, I was told "masks are not returnable".  I suggested that they check the time on the receipt since I couldn't have worn them, but they just pointed to a very small sign near the checkout that said masks were not returnable.  So... a huge bait and switch sale sign, a tiny disclaimer sign, and I am stuck with $25 of worthless little pieces of cloth.  Bad business practices, Old Navy. What good does it do to make a sale that gains you a disgruntled customer?  Old Navy will never get my business again, and I will encourage my friends to stay away, too.

I got asked if I needed help(in a friendly manner) by every associate I passed.  I even had a the manager tell me to come back if I could, and she would help me personally shop for certain looks! I have  officially boycotted the Oxford store. The treatment I received at this store is definitely worth the drive. I beyond highly recommend this Old Navy. I will be back!!!

text: Good experience. Very helpful & knowledgeable about their merchandise. Had to buy a suit, shirt, tie & shoes for my husband for our son's wedding.  A young woman named Kennedy helped us & she was great! Thought prices were reasonable.

name: Donna Bailey
text: Incompetent is one way to describe them. Went in and ordered my son a 40R Chamois jacket. In 3 days, we received a 42R Brown jacket. Wrong size AND color!! I call and I'm told they'll replace it with the right jacket. I have called 3 times for an update.  First one I'm told it's being shipped from CA. Second time, after being put on hold for over 10 mins I hang up. Call back and a manager, which put me on hold the previous time forever, tells me they can't replace it and Fedex lost my package. I've waited 3 weeks for them to get the right jacket and now I need one next week for my son's senior prom. Do Not shop at this place!!!!

text: Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend using them.

name: Ashley Murff
text: Staff is very knowledgeable, versatile selection, affordable. The tape measure around the salesman's neck, I think his name was Adam, the pen in his mouth, his journal, the fit presentations and smiles are a nice touch. :) Great buys, 10 minute hem, no lies!

name: FeC ENG
text:
Overall, we had a good experience at the store, but it was a little odd.

We started out strong meeting a representative, Kate. Who greeted us, was quick, proactive, we liked her. But this other guy cut in and pushed her out. We (myself and the family) liked her. She was respectful, addressed us as soon as we walked in the door, gave us her name, and seemed really easy to work with. The other guy just felt like a salesmen.

We ALL wish we could have kept working with her. I, girlfriend to the stud getting the suits, wish the other guy did not push her out. I wanted her opinion. A young, fashionable, professional woman brings a lot to the table when it comes to attire. I would have respected her input. I hope the company allows her to work closely with clients in the future.

Please note that I have rented suits for myself from Men's Wearhouse so I am also a customer (being a woman in engineering, my friends end up being guys so I end up on the grooms side).

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We apologize for the service difference you experienced in our Birmingham location between Kate and the other associate.  Your shopping experience should be easy and stress free regardless of who you are working with.  We have forwarded this feedback to the management team for review and training purposes so we can improve.  We look forward to an opportunity to better serve you in the future.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Stephen Ruiz
text: Kate was great and very professional. She made me feel at ease, due to the fact I have to ship my rental to Virginia for a wedding in 3 days. She ensured that I would be walking away with a suit once I got to VA regardless. I'm giving 5 stars now for her great customer service and the overall experience. But we shall see in three days of this service holds true!

text:
Great staff that knows their stuff! Helped my buddy and us on his big day with suits, and when one of the groomsmen got a suit that didn’t quite fit they rush ordered another and got it in right on time.

I’d definitely recommend this place for setting up suit rentals or just for asking opinions on a good looking tie.

text: Marcus Lyles Is the most important asset to your store in my opinion. He helped me with my wedding attire and now has helped with 2 custom sport coats. As long as he is on your team I know you will succeed!

name: Gregg
text: My daughter was getting married and I had to rent a tuxedo. I was expecting to be there for a while but the employees couldn't have been more friendly and knowledgeable. The tux was also unbelievably comfortable. If you need shirts, ties, socks etc. they sell these as well. If have recommended to numerous friends and will continue to do so.

name: Stephanie Williams-Velazquez
text: I went to pick a tuxedo for my nephew. I was picking it up because on the previous day when my nephew went to get it, it apparently had been sent to the wrong store. I get there and someone had picked it up from the correct store and neglected to call and inform him. I get to the place where suit was suppose to be and it is too big and no sizes to fit even though he was fitted weeks ago. It is a few hours until the wedding and this child has to wear this if his mom can't find a suit to match.

resp.text:
Hi Stephanie, we are sorry to learn that there were so many issues with your nephew's order. This is certainly not the kind of service that we aim to offer. We would love to help.
Please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Eric Campbell
text: Very attentive, professional and knowledgeable staff. All of my expectations were exceeded. Will shop there again.

name: smjaygal
text: NOT AL ALL CHEAP. That said, this place offers high quality clothing of the suit variety from shoes to shirts. We went here to get my husband fitted for wedding clothes and yes they do that for free and won't throw you out for looking like you can't afford a pocket square. I would absolutely recommend this chain for suit lovers who can afford to drop well over 700 on a full suit.

name: Izz Noland
text:
I have been 5 times already for registering and fitting for my wedding which is now only 5 days from today. My measurements were wrong the first time, so I went back and saw the manager. She measured again and changed everything. When I received my suit for the final fitting, everything was as per the original measurements and too big. They are supposed to overnight my new suit which I'll see 3 days before my wedding.
In addition, my son is very small, and I asked for the smallest fit. He received a regular slim fit instead of extreme slim fit which looks baggy. I was told by the person on duty that they don't have extreme slim fit for children (my son is 11, so I'm paying full price for his rental). I don't believe this to be true and will be speaking with the manager soon. I will not recommend them to anyone else. All of my groomsmen and father of the bride are using them, and the father of the bride at a different Men's Warehouse didn't receive his shoes. I can't believe we're paying $200 / person for all of the hiccups during the preparation phase.

EDIT / UPDATE - My new arrival came in a couple of days before my wedding and fit fine.  In the shuffle, the new order had a white shirt instead of ivory and I didn't realize until the day of my wedding that my shirt was ALL wrong!  Luckily Newnan in GA was able to fix me up.  My mom drove over an hour both ways to get me an ivory shirt.
Meanwhile, I'm waiting on my custom suit.  They were supposed to make up for ALL of this with a "special" custom suit, and there's nothing different about the one I am receiving versus any other Joe Custom Suit.  (mind you there were 7-8 in the bridal party who all rented suits from Men's Warehouses across the Southeast who all had some sort of issue).
I went in yesterday to pick up after my final fitting a week ago, and they had not touched it.  I was told on a Tuesday I could come get it on the weekend.  No calls, no emails, nothing.  So I go in AFTER the weekend and it had not been touched and they said, "wait 10 minutes and we'll have it ready."  NO!  I don't want my custom suit rushed.  I should add that customer service reply 4 months ago gave me a nice discount on my rental, and Kyla and David mean well at this location, but they can't, and shouldn't walk behind all of their employees.
This is the worst experience I've ever had with any establishment in the US. PERIOD. FULL STOP.

resp.text:
We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. We sincerely apologize for all the errors faced in getting the rental garments ready for such a special occasion. We have passed your feedback along to the upper management team for review and training purposes. We’d love the opportunity to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you'd like to discuss your visit with us in greater detail, please email us your wedding group details and best contact number or email at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so a member of our team can follow up with you.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Andrea Bedor
text: Tyler assisted my husband and I with purchasing a suit for our anniversary. He was extremely helpful and loads of fun while we were shopping. He made sure that we were prepared for our special event. They were able to accommodate our very short timeline and they did same day alterations.Thanks Tyler!

text: Easiest time I've ever had buying a suit. Zachary was very knowledgeable and understood our needs. He more than exceeded our expectations and helped find me two sharp suits with matching shoes for a price that didn't break my budget.

name: Joel West
text: I had a great visit the other day. The prices are not the cheapest but to some extent, you get what you pay for. I had a store assistant named Marcus Lyles. He greeted me as soon as I walked in the door. He spent alot of time with me making sure I got everything I needed, that it fit correctly, and looked good. His expertise is priceless and I will shop there again because of him. Great job  Marcus!

text: My husband is 6'2" and 270lbs. His clothes from Men's Wearhouse always fit great.

text: Excellent customer service. I visited for a suit fitting and rental for a wedding party and had a great experience. Knowledgable and courteous staff. In and out in less than 20 minutes. Will return in the future.

name: Thomas Weeks
text: Really great service. Met me at the door and was very personable. Great knowledge and knew exactly how to help me. Without a doubt, will come back.

name: John
text: I had a pleasant experience when it came to this location. Everyone was friendly and worked quickly to get our order done.

name: Lynn Rickard
text: Very helpful and friendly, quick to serve and got us in and out in no time!

name: Shealynn Seaman
text: Ask for Caroline Stephen's! She helped us find the perfect suit for a special mother son outing. Can't say enough about her attention to detail and excellent level of customer service! We will be back!!

name: Christopher Godlewski
text: STAY AWAY!!  This place takes customer service and respect to a new low.  Purchased a jacket to wear IN MY OWN WEDDING, was promised to have it in 2 days . . . delayed going out of town just to get the jacket and it wasn't ready.  Had a bunch of items ordered for possible purchase; was told they'd be in on Wednesday and to just come on in.  Thought better of it and called, no sign of them.  Called back on Friday, the items had been there for days.  The Assistant Manager tells me "sorry, I work with a bunch of idiots".  He then tries to sell me a jacket that's not even close to fitting in the shoulders and tells me "I can just get it altered".  Anyone who knows anything about jackets knows if the shoulders don't fit, the jacket doesn't fit.  Tried to order even more items to exchange for a jacket I'd gotten, can't even get the AM to call me back after he again blamed the "part-timers" that work for him.  DON'T EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.  They should either close this branch or fire everyone and start over.

name: LuckyCharm Gaming
text: Very friendly customer service and very knowledgeable about their suits

name: Echo5191 Cade
text: Got fitted for a tux , it came in a week early so I went to pick it up and  they messed up the color of Vest/ bow tie and pants were way to big , anyway they said they would over night and a week later I just got the call they had it , and they still don’t have it ! My event is Friday and if it’s not in before then  my prom will be ruined! DO NOT EVER GET ANYTHING HERE!! And the staff is extremely incompetent and are Poorly trained !

Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. text: Very impressed with the service at this store. The manager, David, took care of us, was helpful with recommendations and was my personal favorite characteristic, fast.  We were in and out in 20 min.  The reviews are certainly not representative of the level of professionalism at this store. Great work.

text: Really enjoyed the service here. Got all my stuff late but they were right on time. Awesome team!

name: Mike James
text: This Men's Wearhouse is a step above the others in my experience. Marlena and Jeremy are both super awesome and they go above and beyond to provide the best customer experience possible.

name: Chris Barry
text: I was impressed. First time to a Bham Men's Warehouse and was reluctant to visit this location based on previous reviews. New management has done a great job working to right the ship. John was an attentive and patient salesman.

name: Jamie Long
text: The staff here were very friendly and attentive. They were able to help us find what we were looking for in a timely manner.

name: Anthony Colón
text:
I am not having the best service to say the least. The buying process was great,  however, we are now almost a month out from my promised date for my custom made suit. Originally, I needed it for my graduation and was able to wear another suit for that event. They said customs take longer than the original date I was promised, May 9th. They said it would arrive on May 20th instead and I would receive a phone call. No call on that date, I called on the 23rd and it was there. They refitted my pants which is great, and the jacket fits perfect, but said it would arrive today, June 4th. It has not arrived yet.

I think the frustrating part is not that I don't have it, but that it is not ready by the promised date they said it would arrive. Perhaps, better communication would be helpful too. I have another event this weekend I would need it by and hope it arrives before the end of this week.

I feel this is a costly mistake on my end and will be wiser in any future purchases.

(Edit: wrote to email from Men's Warehouse a few days ago and haven't received a response.

Today, June 12th, I called the store and my suit was ready for pick-up. Again, why was I never contacted as they initially said they would reach out to me and let me know when it arrived?

Ideally, I would like to hear a response from Men's Warehouse and hopefully give them input so they can improve with their customer service.)

resp.text:
Anthony,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We would love to reach out to the store and have your concern addressed. If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.

text: For both fitting and picking up a tuxedo rental the staff were not only very professional but extremely friendly and personable. They took the time to make sure everything was done correctly and fit to look my best for the wedding.

name: Everything Bham
text: I went for a fitting and I asked the gentleman that if my friend that asked me to be in his wedding was paying for the rest of the balance,which had been the case in the weddings i had been in the past, will i be able to get my $20 back and he said i had like 2 weeks or something like that from the day i came in so i got fitted on Oct.26 and then went in Oct. 28 and talked to a sweet young lady and she said that since it was not before 2 weeks I couldn't get my $20 back which i was not told at the beginning. I used to work in retail and i would always double check everything and that gentleman said he was sure i could get my $20 back. I would not go here ever again cause the incompetence is awful!! I wouldn't have been fitted if i knew i couldn't get my $20 back.

name: Mitzi Matzke
text: Don’t rent a Tux from here. Very misleading regarding pricing.  Zack should not be working in retail!  Would not even listen to me when I tried to explain what we were told when fitted and placed order.

name: D Watts
text: Avoid! Go to Patton Creek store. They don't know what they are doing at 280 location. Customer is never right. Only person that was perfect at their job on 280 was Hakim Derkaoui, but I haven't seen him in the store the last 5+ visits. Stick to Patton Creek.

name: James Kines
text: They were very helpful in directing me, with it being my first time being fitted for a wedding, and very patient.

name: Stephanie Wardlaw
text: Wonderful service. This was a last minute suit rental and they took great care of us!

name: Cory Truett
text: Helpful staff and good selection. I had a great experience with these guys taking care of me when I was picking out a suit for my wedding.

name: Anita Lockett
text: Great service and was so helpful to my husband, who was asked at the last minute to fill in for a groomsman who drop out the wedding a week before.

name: jimmy harrell
text: This is by far the most unprofessional, lazy, piss poor excuse for a Men's Wearhouse I've ever seen. I spent over $800 on a suit then left it to be "tailored" 5 days later I arrive to pick up my freshly "tailored" suit (WRONG!!) Waist was to tight and the jacket hadn't been touched. I had to leave it for another couple hours why they fixed it. Finally I get the suit and it fit like an $800 suit should. They bag it up, offer no apology for the troubles or delay, and send me on my way. I drive 2 hours home only to find that the idiots didn't bag the tie and pocket square purchased with the suit. I call to inquire about it and the "manager" says yea it's here....you can come pick it back up whenever you get a chance I don't really have another alternative for you. Talk about PISSED!!! Save yourself the trouble and steer clear of this location. The personnel from the top down obviously don't know the meaning of Customer Service.

name: Doug Howell
text:
Great service. Great deals.
Got two jackets on a bogo. Tyler was a great help.

name: Channdra Isom Law
text: Marlena and Hayden were very helpful with the process of getting the remainder of our groomsman tux paid off. 10/10

text: This Men’s Warehouse had an excellent staff, friendly and helpful  Marlena,Marcus,  and Katie were very helpful I will be back in the future.

text: Jeremy and Tyler were amazing in helping me and my buddy out for our dinner plans

name: Tyler Laymon
text: I have dealt with this store in years past and everything went smooth and as expected. This time however was a totally different story. We are not doing the conventional rent a tux for the groomsman thing, we are buying pants, shirt, belt, tie, etc. for the guys since it will end being just as cheap or cheaper and everyone will have some new clothes. All that said we just wanted to get the shirts from them and buy all the other stuff elsewhere. From the beginning it was a fiasco and it never got any better. They are super nice, but they are incompetent, unorganized, unprofessional idiots. During my last visit the assistant manager actually argued, heated might I say, with a customer. They aren't able to keep up with what's going on and the other employees have no clue what the other is doing. How can you run this type of business without everyone in the store knowing what's going on, so when customer comes in to check on an order and no one on the floor knows what the other is doing. This is extremely frustrating and I doubt I will ever use the Men's Wearhouse franchise again due to this horrible experience.

name: Jarrod Walker
text: I see a lot of negative reviews from a while back for this location, but my experience couldnt be further from the truth! Zach was very attentive while helping multiple customers (including myself). He helped me find some good deals and some styles that help me look professional without trying to upsell me. I can't speak to the other salespeople, but if you go in while Zach is there, you'll get good advice.

name: Marsha Lynn
text: No complaints here, nice staff and helpful. My husband found a suit and shoes that suited him.. clean store.

name: Ben Johnson
text: Great service. Tuxe was there on time. Very helpful

text: Save yourself the hassle, drive another 15min and go to the Men's Warehouse at 3664 Riverchase Galleria, Hoover, AL 35244...this 280 store doesn't have their stuff figured out yet. Took over 3 weeks just to get the order placed for a tux for my brother's wedding, including two trips to the store and having to call the store multiple times to find out what is going on (instead of them calling to update on the status).

text: I went in to pick up my tux in march it was the day before the wedding and the tux didnt fit anywhere I ran out the dressing panicking and Zack looked at me like chill dude I got you lol, he adjusted it (which I didnt know you could do) and it fitted perfect he was very professional and laid back I will return and recommend to others

text: Got meassured for my tux for my wedding and the jacket came in a whole size bigger than what I was messured for. Also the button up shirt had the buttons on the wrong side of the left sleeve .

name: Scott Pierce
text: Always a great selection, great sales, and great service. Love this place!

name: Mark Adams
text: Of the three tuxes that were fitted at this location, all three were returned as they were several sizes too small. I looked like Chris Farley dressed as a Chippendales dancer (and I'm not a big person). When the correct tuxes did arrive, they were wrinkled beyond belief. If wrinkled tuxes that are so tight that they cannot be buttoned are your thing, I highly recommend this place.

name: Jessica
text: Absolute worst service ever! My husband went in to get fitted for/pay for a suit for a friends wedding and we had to make 2 trips back to the store that day due to errors on the staff's part. Then my husband went to pick up the suit he has PAID for already and they told him it isnt in yet which it should have been because it had already been a month. One phone call to corporate the suit is magically found so my husband makes yet another trip to the store. Then once he picks the suit up the belt and dress shirt are missing which our receipt clearly states that he has already paid for. We purchased this suit in February and we are still dealing with them to get everything we paid for!! Will never go back once we get everything we have paid for!!!!

name: Doug Hartman
text: I am hard to fit and John took care of me and had me looking good in my new dress shirts for work.

name: Justin Marden
text: Very polite and helpful staff, they assisted me with my tux rental for a wedding. When I picked up my tux, I was in and out in under 20 minutes.

name: Shana Flury
text: Rented a tux and it was completely the wrong size. Had it sent back to be fixed and they promised it would be ready the day of the wedding. It was not, they have no record of the reorder and have nothing to replace it with. While on the phone with them they put me on hold 9 times, and each time a new employee answered the phone where I had to explain the situation again and again. Employees acted like they had never handled a suit fitting before. Will never use men's wearhouse again.

name: Kelsey Chapman
text:
Do NOT go to this store. We had a pretty bad experience with them. I went with my fiance and two brothers to buy them suits for the wedding, and weren't treated very well. My middle brother wears camouflage, jeans and boots all the time and obviously the employees there aren't used to seeing that and deem anyone who does wear it beneath them because there was a very rude comment made about my brother behind his back but within earshot. After our 2 hour trip there, he had to use the restroom, on his way to the restroom he passes by an employee helping a mother and her son. The employee proceeds the comment after seeing my brother "what is that?" And laughs with the mother and son he's currently helping. Strike one. You can tell the man helping us deems it beneath him also because he acted like it pained him to be seen with us and halfway measured them for tailoring until we told him more needed to be done to make the suits look like they should. Strike 2. They tell us at checkout that the suits will be ready in two weeks on a specific date and we could come pick them up. My fiance and I make a special trip again to come pick them up, get there and they have to search for our order and lo and behold....it's not ready. But "don't worry. It will be ready tomorrow. You can just get it then." No we can't because we have to drive for 2 hours and can't just keep doing that on a whim. Not a call, email or anything informing us that the suits weren't ready. I firmly believe they had just stuffed them into the back room and forgotten about them. Strike 3. We have yet to go back to pick up the order because we haven't found the time but I'm waiting for the next mishap. So if you were to ask me, NO do not go to this location. Terrible service. Rude and think they're better.

Let me add: After going the 2nd time to pick the suits up. We had to wait almost 20 minutes for them to locate and 'steam' our suits when we had already called on the way to let them know we were coming to pick them up. Get home with my fiance and he tries everything on, the suit fit good but the shirt was the wrong size and they gave one of my brothers the completely wrong colored vest.

name: Hayden Rankin
text: When I tell you what an experience!! I mean WOW what an amazing experience I had at this location!! Joseph Damico needs to be payed more money!! They need to give this guy a raise! Wonderful customer service from Mr. Damico! I came in the store with expectations of getting a couple ties, and BOOM!! Before I knew it he upsold me and I ended up walking out of there with almost 3000$ of merchandise! Great salesman! I wanted to hire him myself! He as very enthusiastic and says he is ABBOUD! Haha great guy! I told my wife I wanted to pay him to be around me all day!! Lol if you are needing any clothes go to Men's Wearhouse on 280 and ask for Joseph Damico!

name: Christie Estes
text:
To echo what the previous posters have said; it is very unfortunate that you cannot give 0 stars. Better yet, I would assign a negative number if that were an option. If you do not read any further, the takeaway is this: Run don't walk to Jos. A. Bank for tuxedo rentals. I have never encountered such incompetence or ignorance as I have at Men's Wearhouse.

Where shall I begin. . . If you go to Men's Wearhouse you will be lectured ad nauseum about the importance of everyone in your wedding party providing the group number at the fitting. Great in theory. In reality, we were given the incorrect group number. Thankfully, one of the groomsmen caught the error and provided us the correct number. Yes, let that sink in. No one at Men's Wearhouse was competent enough to provide the number. Don't stress the importance of something and then screw it up. We were, of course, offered no explanation as to why we were given the incorrect number.

Moving on to the next issue. I had a coupon from a bridal magazine that I provided during our initial visit. This coupon was to be applied to each tuxedo rental (14 total). Do you think it was applied? Of course not. It came to our attention when several groomsmen commented on the cost of the tuxedo rentals. Of course, there was no explanation for why the coupon was not applied.

At this point, it is Thursday morning and we are getting married on Saturday. Have they called to tell my fiancee that his tuxedo is ready? Of course not.

And, here's the best part of the story, every time I have called to point out some screw up, the phone is answered "Hi. This is _____. How can I provide you with world class service today?" Well, start with doing your job and being competent. But that isn't going to happen. Go to Jos. A. Bank and save yourself the headaches.

name: Melinda Henkel
text: After all of the guys had gone and gotten fitted and paid in full for their tuxes, we ended up having a HORRIBLE experience. Only one of the tuxes fitted right upon pickup. One of the guys had pants that were shorts and 10 sizes too big with a vest that was 5 sizes too big, they wouldn't do ANYTHING to fix it because try to give new pants that didn't match. The junior groomsmen's jacket was too small. One of the shirts had sleeves that were 3/4 type sleeves instead of full length meaning he couldn't remove his jacket. It was horrible and I am still not done, we deserve to have our money back.

name: Michael Koratich (BioGuy)
text: Service is exceptional price even at BOGO is a bit steep.

name: amy deloach
text:
There are far too many things wrong with this store. Where do I begin?

I'd give zero stars for this particular location, but 1. you can't give 0 stars on Google Reviews, and 2. we did actually have a good experience renting our wedding tuxes with one of the managers Homer (who is the only competent employee here, so I give a star to Homer. And well, we didn't actually pick up the wedding tuxes at this location, just placed the order, but I'm pretty sure if we did get them from here something would've gone wrong.) but everything else we have tried to do at this store was a complete fail.

My husband ordered a couple suits and two pairs of pants to get alterations done. They completely wonked up the alterations and made the suit look like a baggy potato sack. We actually did extensive research on how men's suits should fit and the finished product didn't turn out to look anything like the books.

Not only were the alterations terrible but they weren't completed on time. Something about the pants not being shipped on time, but they were smart on their part and gave us a phone call to tell us it wasn't ready when they said it would be.

After the messed up all the alterations my husband went back for a second fitting to have them fix the problem. The first suit was completed in a timely manner and turned out exactly how he wanted it to be. They told him to come back the next Saturday and the other suit and two pairs of pants would be done by then.

This is where things get screwy. The second suit's alterations were completely off, and it seemed like no one had touched them. Pair of pants #1 were even longer and baggier than the pants on the suit, like they definitely were not touched or tailored whatsoever. They were too long by a good 4-5 inches and too baggy in the waist. ON TOP OF ALL THIS PAIR OF PANTS #2 WAS NOT DONE AND NO ONE HAD CALLED OR INFORMED US THEY WERE NOT READY. They said the tailor had left for the day. SO WE HAD DRIVEN AN HOUR TO GO TO THIS STORE TO PICK UP NOTHING BECAUSE ALL THE ALTERATIONS WERE WRONG AND THE ORDER WASN'T EVEN COMPLETED.

It is very very very clear that some managers in here are not doing their jobs correctly. I came here on a Saturday night - the store was a mess. There were ties and handkerchiefs not hung up, hangers not spaced evenly apart, the phone was ringing of the hook and no one was picking it up, and all the employees were either watching TV and I believe the manager was outside on his cell phone. It is clear that the tailors, or at least one of them doesn't have a brain and is completely incompetent. I understand that these people are most likely overworked or underpaid but it is such a disappointment to receive poor customer service in our economy because there are plenty of people who are more intelligent and harder working that can't find jobs because schmucks like the people at Men's Wearhouse are getting paid to watch TV, talk on their cell phones, and leave work before getting their jobs done.

This store is a joke and it is pathetic. We will never ever be back again.

name: Alex Green
text: They measured me and had my suit tailored and ready in only a week with good buys and good deals.

name: Jacob Roberts
text: If you're in the market for some really nice men's clothing this is the place for you! There's always a deal going on too.

name: K P
text: The managers at this store are completely incompetent and unhelpful. Please do not shop there! I should have read the reviews before walking in the door and it would have saved me hours of stress. We tried to do a wedding through this store and it has taken 5 phone calls over a month period to even get the information put into the system so the groomsmen can order their suits. I have been so disappointed with the way the problem has been handled because there has been nothing but lies and excuses. The sales staff give the impression that they are helpful but once you walk out the door they do not follow through on their word. I was told this store got an entirely new staff based on poor performance in the past... it's time to get new management again. I will never go back and I warn all of you to do the same.

text: Needed clothes for a funeral, the sales rep attempted to take advantage of the situation by only showing items grater than $500. After the debacle was finished I had to return multiple items that were included with out my permission. They would only allow me to return the items at a reduced price.

If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

text: I love coming here! This location is huge and has literally everything! We have to look at everything when we come here. I always have to buy fudge. This time we got the cookies and cream flavor. We will always have a reason to stop here when we travel through Spanish Fort.

name: Lillian-Lotus Buccola
text: Even if you dont come here for shopping. Take the kids to see the fish tank. And at Christmas get a free picture with Santa! They did amazing with Covid rules.

name: April Brockmiller
text: We love going here because my son loves it. A lot of their stuff is over priced but they have a lot that is very re so able too. Always clean. Friendly ppl for the most part.

name: Jay Frigon
text: Larger than the location I usually go in Destin.  Ample parking and everything was well stocked except for ammo.

name: Erika Moran
text: Cool place to visit. My 1st time at a Bass Pro Shop. Would recommend going at least once to check out the set up,the Bass and Alligator Gar tank&the gorgeous boats are a plus!! Lots of Country Instagram worthy props in there! Lol 😆😆😆 Also I thought most of the stuff was over priced in there. Just a little!

name: Mudd Mannipulater
text:
Smaller store than what I am use to. Staff was around but not overly helpful. The woman working the door was very helpful and a great example of how All the employees should act. The check out process was excellent. The staff on the 2nd floor were on their phones and they showed no motivation. The guy in the gun department was the same. He could not find the item I wanted. He didn't offer to order it in or to order it on-line. I was willing to do either.
The boat and ATV guy lost a sale  since they could not break free from their conversation to help me. I hate pushy sales people but at least acknowledge me after you see me taking pictures and returning to the same area 3 times.
I never saw anyone in the clothing departments so I didn't get the items that I wanted  to stock up on.
I return to Bass Pro because of the quality of the products and it is normally easy to get help. I did not find that at this store.
It was a surprise to find the outside water features seemed neglected too.  I  didn't see any fish and the fountains and falls that are normally seen were not there either.
Luckily I can find another store close by to get what I'm looking for.
I spent FAR less than I normally do at THIS Bass Pro store and I still need to do my spring shopping.
I will not return to this store if I can another one close by.

Please understand that this store is not exactly bad, it just doesn't have the warm welcoming flow and energy that I have grown fond to.

name: Anthony Moore
text: I went bass Pro shop in Daphne Al. Barely got in the door before someone started trying to sell me a vacation, you know where they send you somewhere and try to sell you something. I love seeing all the new stuff bass Pro shop has to offer , didn't appreciate that

name: Charles Allen (Chuck)
text: Great place to shop for all your outdoor needs.

name: Anthony Moore
text: I went bass Pro shop in Daphne Al. Barely got in the door before someone started trying to sell me a vacation, you know where they send you somewhere and try to sell you something. I love seeing all the new stuff bass Pro shop has to offer , didn't appreciate that

name: Jody Carter
text: We arrived 45 minutes prior to closing and needed camping supplies. A staff member at the door pointed us upstairs and we headed towards Camping. There were no staff upstairs and we couldn't find what we needed. I had to go downstairs and into the Fishing section to find an employee. He said everyone was doing inventory and not helping customers. He looked online, found the item I needed, and confirmed the were out of stock. He then referred me to Walmart if I need it quickly.

name: James Shouldis
text: it's a great place to shop. for clothes as well Sporting Goods, cookout equipment as well as smoking equipment  always enjoy going there.

name: Cristy Atkinson
text: Great help in the boat dept. The clearance items were still a little pricey but you can find some finds. Checking out was really helpful as I had gift cards and discounts on my card.

name: Kriss Payne
text: Our puppies had a great time exploring the store, huge selection.

name: Roy Forrest
text: This is without a doubt my favourite outdoor sporting goods store in all of Alabama Bass Pro Shops has everything I want it's like being a kid in a candy store with unlimited resources for money it is just an outstanding place I could actually spend the whole day in there and never feel like I got everything I wanted to get done finished And the associates in Bass Pro Shops are beyond reproach they are so helpful and so courteous and they are very easy to talk to and extremely knowledgable I truly cannot say enough good about this place.

name: George Cates
text: 58 years old in my day we would look at the sears cateloge and the first real gun we would get , fishing gear , bikes daydream for ever. Today I walked into the dream but it was real!!!! Great people quality merchandise. My first day in Bass Pro  Shop!!!! Going back next week. Take weeks to see it all.

name: Elizabeth Williams
text: Such a cool place...me and my kiddos had a great experience.  My son finally found his boots he'd been wanting and me and my daughter enjoyed the fish

name: Wanda Kelley
text: Love coming to the Bass Pro Shop during the holidays.  It's so very festive and beautiful.  My favorite, of course, is the fireplace! The Christmas tree was awesome! The sales associates were extremely friendly and helpful.  My grandson and I had a great time.

name: Sierra Wyndsong
text: They always have everything we need, and they always provide exceptional service!

name: Cosmic Librarian
text: Who doesn't enjoy walking around Bass Pro? It was a very quiet Friday afternoon and my family and I were able to take our time and enjoy walking through the store. Nice place with friendly employees.

name: Hope Gainey
text: Great service here for husband's engine as expected and so many cute clothes!! Haha, didn't know they had clothes.

name: William Griffith
text: All employees were so welcoming when we brought our dog. They were even gracious enough to give him a treat.

name: Brian Boland
text: Always love bass pro we have seen 30 of them some are spectacular. This one was no exception

name: Joseph Hardin
text: At this bass pro they were more worried about pushing their Mastercard program than actual customer service. I was trying to buy boots in their shoe dept and needless to say the associate never came. After waiting an hour nobody walked through. Plus the associate where the guns are so acted like I was interrupting his conversation. I'm very disappointed. I'm not a local to this place I was passing through and it turned out to be a total waste of time.

text: Nicely decorated store with rocks and aquarium with fish. The only I did not liked that it has a bunch of stuffed animals. I hope they are fake. I am sorry for that animals if they are real stuffed animals.

text: They had good selection. Also a great place to go if you want to get COVID. They were NOT enforcing mask rule. To afraid of making an issue. I spoke to the manager, of course he did nothing.

text:
Clean and well organized.    Unfortunately they are short on ammo and reloading supplies like everyone else.

However the fishing section is stocked which is a plus.

name: Vance Blackburn
text:
This place is enormous!  We have visited one of their similar stores in Pennsylvania and were not disappointed.

Incredible detail to store layout and decorating makes this a place to see for yourself. A true place to bring the whole family for hours of enjoyment.

The kids will enjoy everything from the untold number of mounted animals to the shooting gallery. The usual point of sale goodies can be found at every register, but the real goodies are found in the old time store... The fudge is awesome!  Sit down meals and available at the in-store restaurant offering a variety of animal meats.

I was impressed with the knowledge the staff had in their respective departments. The gun area had well trained staff and offered many hints on the model I was interested in.  My wife hit the women's clothing like a fire sale and found some great outfits.

This store is very accessable to those people with disabilities. The elevators are great for those of us with bad knees.

This place gets a big five star rating.

name: Kim Low
text: Clean. Friendly. Packed out but after this past year I was happy to see all the faces (all employees had masks on but all the customers didn't since the mayor(?) ((The news)) canceling face masks in our area yesterday) walking around and shopping.

name: Brent
text: Always Awesome!!  Very  Knowledgeable people

name: Mike Brown
text:
I shopped online for sale items and placed order. All went well with online purchases and received email a few minutes later that my order was in progress and I would receive a email when all the order was ready for pickup. All this was at 6:00 am. I thought all was good and I wasn't going to have to stand in line at the store because I'm not in physical condition for that and do most of my shopping online. Thirteen hours later I received a email from Bass Pro that my order was canceled due to items now was not available and wouldn't be offered at that price again after that sale date.
The online service is not your friend and is not a good way to shop deals at Bass Pro..☹
There's other stores that have excellent online service !

name: Jody Carter
text: We arrived 45 minutes prior to closing and needed camping supplies. A staff member at the door pointed us upstairs and we headed towards Camping. There were no staff upstairs and we couldn't find what we needed. I had to go downstairs and into the Fishing section to find an employee. He said everyone was doing inventory and not helping customers. He looked online, found the item I needed, and confirmed the were out of stock. He then referred me to Walmart if I need it quickly.

name: James Hunter
text:
If I had to explain why its great...
Walk in , feel it and stay. Don't feel it...probably not your cup of coffee.

name: ArkanShadowFox H.E.B.
text: Good place, clean floors, but children need to be supervised better. Too many parents let their kids run around screaming by the gun cases on the second floor. Very distracting.

Awesome setup, awesome Santa, awesome time.

name: Jim Divers
text:
How can I cancel this order? Ordered on the 17th of December and still no info on when it will ship.
Thank you for choosing Basspro.com. Below is a complete transcript of your conversation with our Outfitter.

Chat By Chat (Sharla W.) (01/01/2021 07:12 PM)
[07:05:52 PM]You are now connected with Sharla W..
[07:06:09 PM]Jim Divers: How can I cancel my order
[07:06:22 PM]Sharla W.: Good evening Jim
[07:06:38 PM]Sharla W.:
It will be my pleasure to assist.  One moment please.

[07:06:45 PM]Jim Divers: W127276569
[07:06:54 PM]Sharla W.: Thank you
[07:08:36 PM]Sharla W.: I apologize your order should ship next week.  As it is in the shipping process, I cannot cancel the order.
[07:09:18 PM]Jim Divers: So if it does not ship next week how do I cancel?
[07:11:25 PM]Sharla W.: Unfortunately, due to the high demand, our warehouses have gotten behind.  We are not able to cancel order when they are in the shipping process.  If your order does not ship by Wednesday, please contact us and we will check to see if the item is no longer available or can be canceled.
[07:11:46 PM]Jim Divers: Thanks
[07:11:57 PM]'Jim Divers' disconnected ('Concluded by End-user').

I tell them that I have to work and that I just drove an hour and they tell me to come another time and call ahead. name: Rachael Ralph
text:
We've come out here in the past to shop and visit with Santa and have had a good time. This year was absolutely dismal. It started out bad in the messy bathrooms. The floors were covered in trash. Only one of the paper towel dispensers were working, and barely at that, only if you pulled it out in a certain way. It took 3 strangers and myself to find the working dispenser and get paper towels out of it, it was a team effort.
There were far less people in the store than previous years, so I'm not sure what their excuse would be. Most of the children's attractions were broken or half working as well. The kids were practically bored to tears. We only stayed for pictures with Santa. Our wait was 2 hours. And by all means it should have been half that time. There really weren't many people in the store. Crafts that were supposed to start at noon didn't begin till around 12:30 and the craft person was stale and thoroughly uninterested in their job. Before when we had come there was quite a bit of interaction and Mrs. Clause even came over to help.
It was a total waste of time coming out here. Their restaurant isn't even open anymore. So much for being a kids event. I didn't even make our purchases, and we obviously had lunch elsewhere. I can buy this stuff elsewhere too lol.

name: Michael Thomas
text:
Mr Jim Hagale / CEO Johnny Morris

I purchased a boat through your company (Spanish Fort) and wanted to directly share my TERRIBLE experience with you.

13 Jul 20:  Purchased the Regency R230LE3 Sport for $67,759

After the staff inspection and detail of the boat, it was delivered to my home on 13 Jul.

After delivery I called sales rep to inform him that: Boat Cover not included, Ski Pole missing, cushion springs to get into the departments not working, missing console cover piece, crack in fiberglass of console, latch for shower bracket broken, trickle charger outlet not secured to boat. (Items needing replacement when purchased: Co Captain Chair had tear, 2 seat cushions had tears, sun shade cover needed replacement, radio (2 control panels) need replacement).

14 Jul 20:  Put boat in the water, trim gauge did not work..... AND BOAT STARTED TO SINK ON RIGHT SIDE!

Got boat out of the water, called sales rep and I took the boat back to Spanish Ft on 15 July.

Determined, leak in right side pontoon. Was informed I must go through the warranty process to get it fixed.  I have played this game now for 8 days.  NO CHANGE TO THE BOAT!  STILL WAITING FOR WARRANTY OFFICE TO CONTACT DEALERSHIP!

I told them to replace the boat or take the boat back.

I have been told by your Finance Dept to call dealership.

I have been told by your Corp Customer Service Rep to call dealership.

Dealership says:  That's not how it works, you will not get a replacement and we will not cancel the loan.

So, here we are.  Me emailing the CEO to get help!

The boat has not even been titled or funded yet.  This experience and your company customer service is absolutely unacceptable.  Bass Pro Shop sells a retired military man a boat that starts to sink in the first 30 mins of ever touching the water, confirmed by staff it has a leak and was told.... we will file a warranty claim.  Sorry about your Luck!

Can't wait to share this experience with my community, with your community!

Mike Thomas

text: This place is like something out of a movie. Seriously, not many places in the locale that has the epicness of BPS. Kids had a blast. The aquarium's, the trophy displays, the target shooting game with animatronics, the glass elevator, the sweets and candle gift shop, the restaurant, and on. The building is a landmark. Well worth a stop if you're in the vicinity.

text: Went to the store in Daphne AL to get two items. Sold all stock of Gambrels & insulated jump suits in stock were sizes from XL to 4XL. No "regular" guy sizes. Stock is thin. Also the boar & deer mounts above the gun counter are completely covered with lint & dust. Was not impressed.

text: One of the best RV overnight spots + the Bass Pro Shop is very welcoming.  The store was running some clearance specials that found there way into our wardrobe.  This store is especially nice.  We enjoyed our visit.

name: Jimmie Rodgers
text: Gotta go it’s the closest one in t(e panhandle of FL

name: Ronald Clement
text: Extremely disappointed at the customer service I received at this store location. I tried to purchase a flannel/hoodie combo shirt, that was marked on one of the middle store isle racks, for $17.99 as advertised on the sign above the rack ( at 0910 AM). They were marked down from $44.99. I went and did about 15 more minutes of shopping and went to check out (at 0925 AM). At check out the item showed up as $44.99 and I said I would take it over to refund for them to research the price further. The associate at the refund desk stated the price was never $17.99 and there was no sign there showing it was ever that price. My wife walked back there and could you imaging the signs mysteriously vanished from the time I picked up the item at the rack to the time I went to check out. I was made to look like a liar and a cheat by the refund associate and Bass Pro. The only thing they had to say was they had mistakenly left the sales signs up from the weekend and I would have been okay with that. Instead I had to listen to the other refund associate say I was in the right and the signs were removed late but she could not make the other associate listen to her. Funny how they want to thank you for your military service one minute and then make you out to be a liar in front of other customers the next. I will no longer be shopping at the Bass Pro Spanish Fort location and I would suggest that all customers take photos of sales prices on the racks for they are to be susceptible removed at a moments notice to prove the customer is wrong and vendor is in the right.

name: Bonnie Jean Kyllo
text: FANTASTIC!

name: Ernest Dallemolle
text: Decent store with variety of clothing and sporting items.  Pricing not bad, especially if looking at discount racks.  Easy environment to shop in.  Brother in law and I took road trip to come here.  Other than traffic near exit, get enjoyable day.

name: Taylor Barnes
text: Very rude customers using foul language and actually being aggressive towards other families waiting to see Santa. I only let that effect my post because employees witnessed this and even let them proceed to jump everyone in line, silently, just to get rid of them. I wasn't raised to reward bad behavior! Other than that, very nice store, but you'll lose great customers to white trash just there for a free picture!

Very nice shopping experience. Would like to see more variation of modern carbines and sporting rifles.
Also no Kalashnikovs which was a disappointment.

name: Tony Seybert
text: I bought a gun on line to ship to the store.when I arrived at the store a greeter was at the front,  ask where to pickup my online gun .I was told service desk in front, stood in line , service person said no you have to go to gun department. I arrived at gun counter no one around ,found a guy putting up stock showed my paper work .he acted like never saw an on line order.he brought out paper work I filled out , once approved,  I ask about red dot scopes. I was told find a better deal on line , didn't ask if I needed ammo ect .no one in the store was friendly,  acting as if mad they had to work.i won't be back over priced any way .I had no one ask me if I needed an help in the store .I was wearing ppe so what's up bass pro .I have a 5000.00 dollar limit credit card , I'd close it for not lowering my credit score. Teach your people some customer service,  or you might be joining  j.c. penny .

text: Way to zealous with club card

name: Is St
text:
Woa. So much stuff and they had so many sales. The men section is much bigger in clothing and better quality stuff but thats no surprise. Great sales in the bags and clearance clothes.
Huge store. Might wanna spend 3-4 or more hours in there if you like multiple things. They have a huge yearly catalog on the doors out so just ask someone for that if you dont wanna be in the store long. Amazing, huge, great, visuals/decorations, lots of stuff

name: Mogg Moggleson
text: Bass pro shops is kinda like a theme park for outdoorsman, but with less rides. I mainly go there for shooting supplies and firearm related stuff, which they have in abundance. Most of what they don't have they can order. Prices are about in line with other stores, and selection is better than average. They stock lots of reloading supplies and tools, holsters, mags, and ammo by the literal ton.

name: Ordanumn
text: I turned in a compound bow about six weeks ago to get it restrung. I was told it would take about 3-4 weeks to order parts and repair the bow. After around five weeks I called to check on my bow and they said they would call me back. I recieved no call back so I called again and was put on hold, then was hung up on. I went to the store to check on it in person and after waiting 30 minutes I was informed that they haven't even ordered the parts yet. I am taking my business elsewhere,  sadly I will not  shop here again.

name: Charlie1219
text: Black Friday "sales" were a joke. The few things I was looking for were either not available or usual price. Most employees looked like they were too busy to help.

name: Mike Guidry
text: Great experience today

name: Roy R.
text: The store was very large and very well stocked and very clean. Of course, it must make it a lot easier to keep it that way when nobody buys anything. This is a store for the well heeled. 50 dollar shirts and 17 dollar ball caps are not for everyone. Their wide ranging stock and impressive choices are a spectacle, and the store itself is a must see, but don't plan a trip there AND Disneyland in the same year if you work for an hourly wage. Probably awesome for the pro's with sponsors, but I'll have to stick to Goodwill.

text: Smallest most under stocked outdoor Bass pro shops I've ever been to

name: Curtis Jackson
text:
I've had bad experiences my last 2 visits
I needed a new dehydrator so I went to bass pro, I knew what I wanted and where it was so I got there just about 20 minutes till closing. I zipped up to the section I wanted and saw what I wanted, well it was more than I could lift so I looked around for someone to help me. Not finding anyone I changed my mind and went with 2 smaller units as I'm standing there figuring the difference in price a sales lady showed up to tell me the store was closing that I needed to leave. I told her ok but she could put the 2 units back on the shelf. She changed her mind  so I took the 2 smaller units and left. Definitely not what I was expecting
Today I went to get some black Friday sales on electronics for ,y pontoon and I took2 hunting knives to get sharpened. I get there and I run upstairs to drop them off while I shopped. I asked if I could get my knives sharpened and the kid told me they were to busy selling guns that I would need to leave the knives and come back tomorrow. Well they lost around 2000 dollars in sales in electronics today because if that's the attitude of bass pro I'll shop elsewhere

text: Love this place i just wish I didn't have to drive all the way to Alabama or destin to visit the closest one to me

text: Love this place

text: Wide selection, seem to be more specialized toward outdoor stuff on the gulf coast. Examples, fishing, salt and fresh water.

name: Rushing Waters
text: The workers are always friendly and they're good for finding specialty items.

name: Kelsey Rummel
text: You can bring your dogs inside

name: Kerry AnnaBelle
text: We like taking a trip to Bass Pro shops for a quick family drive.  We used to go to the restaurant before it was closed but still a nice getaway.

name: Benjamin Harms
text: I'm not a sports lover or fisherman by any stretch of the imagination. But, I found this store to be really incredible!  The layout was a little overwhelming and felt sprawling. The line to see Santa was unbelievably long, so we took a pass on that. According to my sister, the best time to go for a picture with Santa is on a weeknight, rather than on a Sunday afternoon. Haha The stairway that trails up beside the fish tank was in and of itself a fun attraction. The elevators were even nicely themed to compliment everything. I was really impressed with the entire ecosystem that they have designed. The prices were higher than I would ever want to pay for simple gift ideas, but this just isn't a simple gift kind of place. The gift shop had some yummy options from party mix to crazy flavors of mixed nuts and cotton candy, and even Bacon Hot Chocolate (but even at only $1.49 per pack, I was still afraid to buy and try it). We also ate at the restaurant, which I wrote a review for separately. Great experiences to be had here!

name: Robert Watson
text: Employees are nice, helpful and friendly.

name: Johnny Collins
text: Great selection. Good people that are willing to help.

name: Marivel Preciado
text: 1st time at Bass Pro Shop & it was a welcoming experience. David of the fishing dept was very helpful. He really took the time out to answer all my questions from fishing gear to local fishing spots, as I was visiting from Texas. His awesome customer service definitely must be recognized!!

name: L T
text: High prices, pretty good fudge.

name: Ginny Phillips Allen
text: Massive inventory, kid friendly. Friendly personnel greeted, but no one ever offered to help. Live fish in aquarium under waterfall and catfish in "creek" were impressive! I've never seen an albino catfish before. It was huge!

name: Patricia CARBONE
text: poor quality

name: Thomas Ausborn
text: Bass Pro Shops of Spanish Fort is a veritable treasure trove of goodies for casual and seasoned outdoorsmen alike. The store is vast and features a pleasing atmosphere. The inventory is diverse and well stocked. The employees are helpful and knowledgeable. Pricing is reasonable for most products though sometimes quite high for specialty goods. A visit to the store is sure to be a positive experience even if you don't plan on making any purchases. It can be kind of just a fun place to peruse.

name: Phyllis Wallace
text: This is always a fun place to go.  I love taking the kids here.  There is a lot for them to do.  The restaurant is pretty good too.

name: David Clark Sr
text:
Unbelievable.  This pretty much sums it up.
If this place doesn't have what you are looking for.  You probably don't need it.
Very nice employees and clean .
Very large and well laid out in sections. You could spend a complete day  in this store.
From fish hooks to complete boat rigs,  it's in this building
Price is ok and mostly competitive.
I was very impressed  and you will be too.
There are fish aquariums and very nice restaurants.
5 stars.

name: Emily Hubble
text: It was my first time visiting a salt water bass pro. I felt like a kid in a candy shop!

name: SheriMarie Zurenko

No better way to run off customers than to make them feel like you think they are thieves. I work all over the country and this is my "local" Basspro and can't do business with anyone who makes us feel like they we are thieves. No other basspro does this! Not to mention we both had Costa's on our head!!! Very disappointing.

text: First time visiting this Bass Pro.  It was awesome as any other Bass Pro.  The place had everything.  It was clean and well organized.  The staff was friendly and attentive, but not pushy.  I'll definitely be going back!

text: Always a great store what ever state it is. The guy in the boat sales was great friendly man. Thanks Bass Pro Shop!

name: Agnes Jones
text: The store was clean . Restrooms were very nice. The prices were very high. The Cadillac of sporting good stores.

name: Pat Mason
text: Fun place to shop. They have a great selection. Food is good. The aquarium is nice

name: Megan Bolton
text: Wish they had better sales. I also wish that they sold more for plus size women. Not all women who like to fish, hunt, etc are considered average and shouldn't have to resort to wearing mens clothes for comfort

name: Chad Warnol
text: Great atmosphere with a good selection on outdoor items. Typical for most Bass Pro Shops.

name: Tiffany Bodie
text: Every year I bring my family to bass pro shop to take pictures with santa do some Christmas shopping. I love bass pro shop all together but today we had a horrible experience. We had to digitally sign up to take pictures with santa and we got there at 11:30 the wait was 2.5 hrs so after shopping going out to eat we came back at 2 exactly 2.5 hrs to find out there was another 50 minutes to wait okay no big deal we do more shopping with three kids finally we get the message at 3:30 that its time to take pictures with Santa to only find out their system is down and it'll be another two hours of waiting and all the people who weren't able to sign up to take pictures will be completely turned away as the bass pro shop employee stated. My kids were crushed when we told them we had to leave because I had to go to work in an hour and they spent all day being patient waiting to see santa. I'm one family out of a whole store full that went through this I hope they come up with a better system by next year but honestly I dont think we will be coming back to see santa it's much easier and less of a hassle to just go to the mall.

name: Ben Piatt
text: No fudge but its ok.

name: Jeremiah Ingram
text: Isn't what it used to be!

name: Longrange Doc
text: Prices are a little high but they have a large selection. You are also paying for the atmosphere.  Do not trust the website when I says they have something in stock I drove over an hour to be there when they opened to get something I needed that said they had in stock at this store and it was out of stock!!! To the staffs credit they where very nice and tried their best to find it and the computer said it was in stock for them too

name: John Sanders
text: Very enjoyable,talked with several employes. They were very cordial and knowlegable about the products that I asked about.

name: Sarah Shwec
text: Great customer service! Took my child to see the Easter Bunny,  the employee's were awesome, especially with all the children. Thanks!

name: Faith mom

text: The store was absolutely beautiful I love the aquariums. Not sure if I'm going to contact corporate about it or not other than that and the exorbitantly high prices it is an absolutely beautiful store.

text:
The Spanish Fort BPS has a good selection of both freshwater and saltwater fishing gear and tackle.  This store typically has quite a few Mako boats on hand as well as many pontoon boats.  The store sits close to Mobile bay and I-10

There are a few department stores in the same shopping center, but not much else.

Also your company just deletes my rewards points. I am done.

name: Jamilah Haseeb
text: We visited Bass Pro shop on 8.1.18, which was our anniversary. I am only giving a 2 star rating because the man at the entrance was polite and Deandra at the Outdoor Traveler booth was excellent. We received no customer service anywhere else in the store. We went up stairs to the guns because I was interested in buying one. There were 2 associates there speaking to one customer at the counter. As we proceeded to the counter to look at the selection we were never acknowledged by them. Not even a simple greeting, even though we browsed near the counter and the camping section for several minutes. We then decided to go down stairs. We passed 2 more associates and was never acknowledged. We went to the general store. There was only one associate there and she had a line (This was the only place in the whole store that had a line of customers). We browsed  there hoping the line would soon shorten but no additional help came so we left... Just poor customer service for a business that was not that busy. Very disappointed.

text: My 11 year old grandson needed a new pair of camo water boots. Got a great brand at a great price. He wears them all the time. He would wear them to school if they would let him. name: Stephen Hoist
text: I have been going to the Spanish Fort location for several years.  It had been a while since I was last in there.  I have never had an issue before but this time I was there to spend some money.  I went up to look at a  rifle scope that I had been looking at online.  I went upstairs and took the long way to get there.  We were greeted properly walking in so didn't see any reason to think anything else.  We walked through the bows, then walked past the rifle racks to the scopes.  The guys working the counter were working with other customers so I looked around, I found the one I wanted to see.  In that process, I found another that I was interested in I looked up to see the status of the salespeople and they were over on the other side talking to each other and what looked to be looking at a phone behind the counter.  I left the counter went to check on kids who were by the aquarium.  We walked around and I decided I was going to get both of the scopes I found.  I went back and both salespeople were talking to one person.  So while I was waiting, I found a third scope I wanted.  The lady they were talking to left and they went back to the other end of the counter and did what they were doing before.  Now I don't like when a salesperson hovers over me, but I have worked in retail enough to at least let a customer know I am there to help.  I couldn't even get that out of them, so we walked away.  They missed a out a $4K sale.  I am not going to beg for them to help me.  They weren't busy.  The way I see it is they were just busy ignoring me.  Walking to the exit, I found a gear bag for a decent price and decided to buy it.  The man at the cash register was awesome.  If the guys at the gun counter were, Bass Pro would have sold me a lot more than a $12.99 bag.  I will go back again.  Like I said, this was the first time I had a bad experience there.

name: STEPHEN KEARNEY
text: You have to visit this store...they have everything.  Very knowledgeable staff

name: Jimmy Wayne
text: Brought in a 13 Concept A3 baitcaster which is a 200 dollar and up reel. I have taken many of reels to this location and have never had an issue at all with any of them untillll today. I was explaining to the associate that this reel has a special coating and I would get it spooked somewhere else if he thought their machine would scratch it and this special coating is to guard it against saltwater. I confidently walked around and did some more shopping picked up my reel and checked out and went on about my work day. On my way home I peeked In the box to find the top of my new expensive reel scratched up and the coating removed. I have no confidence in this store was told that they would handle the situation and call me back later and low and behold here we are with a scratched up reel I do not want to fish with due to it might corroding and the warranty is void. I’ll update if they make it right but lost all confidence in their pro service.

I'm going here today with my 4 year old because i have a bunch of gift cards saved up and can get him some cool toys. We then kept looking around. Stopped at the aquarium and sat at the benches around it for a little bit. Went to look at camping items and my husband and son went to look at weapons so my daughter and I sat at the bench on an overlook to rest and look at all the diaramas around the store. name: Jenn Daughenbaugh
text: My husband went to the Bass Pro Shop in Daphne, Al. today, looking to purchase a small boat or kayak for fishing. He went into the tracker boat section, spoke with two elderly gentlemen, he doesnt rememeber his name but the gentleman that let him back in the building after looking at the boats outside didnt say anything to him, just opened the door and walked away. So he approached another gentleman sitting at the desk, asked about one of the boats they had outside and about financing, the gentleman’s response was if you dont have a 700 or better they wont finance you and they wont finance anything under $5000.00. Assuming because of how my husband looked that his score was under a 700. So my husband went inside and started looking at kayaks, he was up there for close to an hour and was not approached one time by a sales associate to see if he needed help, at that point he left the store. So not only did you lose a possible sale on a boat you also lost out on the sale of a kayak. Your salesman in the tracker boat section are extremely rude and all your employees need some educating on customer service and he will never shop in another Bass Pro Shop again.

name: Whitney McCaskill
text: I went around 2:30 or 3 to pick up a santa pass and told the lady I got the pass from I would be coming back after I got myself and my dogs ready. I had a 6:00 pass, so around 5 I loaded up myself, my fiancé and our 4 dogs, just too be told at the door that santa wouldn’t take pictures with animals... if I was told that when I picked up the pass, it would’ve been fine. But to be told once we got there really upset me. I’m not sure if it’s just this bass pro that doesn’t allow pics with animals or what but for the last 3 years I’ve taken pics with santa and my dogs. So we will be traveling to prattville for our picture with santa from now on.

text: Vista the store 7/8/2017 I was looking for kitchen towels with a bear theam and knew this was the place to find them. Find them I did on the bottom shelf in the fudge room. The stack was coverd with mouse droppings, mouse hair and left nut casings. REALLY 3 employees in there not helping customers clearly they should be checking their goods. Gross. Continued to shop ready to check out and only 2 lanes open on a Saturday with a packed store. The place was full of employees but none seemed to be doing much more than standing around. After 15 min in line and not moving much at all we left our full cart and walked away.  On the way out the employee at the exit asked how we enjoyed our BP experience I let her know about the mouse mess and wait to checkout her response was "owell that's BP guess you won't be back" drove an hour and half and won't do that again.

text: My husband and I just bought a sport coat from D&K. The person who helped us was very helpful. I only took a star away because the carpet is in terrible shape and the store seemed dimly lit. Other than that we were very happy with the coat and the service.

text: Friendly  ,professional staff with a good selection! Will be back!

name: Mike McCants
text: Paid for rental Tux in advance never called to say it was in.  I called a couple of times and still not in.  Showed up on Friday only to find out I looked like an orphan.   Arms on my jacket covered my hands completely and pants were 4 inches to short.  Said they would have ready by close of business or I could pick up Saturday morning at ten.  We got there by 11 and the jacket had been altered but the pants not touched.  Went to men's Warehouse and bought a new tux for a few dollars more than the rental from D&K.  Had tux fited and out the door in about 2.5 hours altered and all from Mens Warehouse.  Will never go back to D&K.  Go to Mens Warehouse they will take care of you without breaking your wallet and the service is so much better.

I usually pick out his suits, ties, shirts, and shoes myself but the do have employees that are very helpful and attentive ready to help if needed. I like the fact that they have a seamstress there to alterations that are usually ready the same day.

name: Disney Sparks
text: This place is huge! You really need to go into the store to get a grasp on all they have to offer. Suits in ever color and size, and all the accessories to go with it at unbeatable prices. We ended up getting all the suits, shoes, and accessories for my wedding party here. They made the guys so handsome! Great quality, great fit, and they do alterations on site. We are so pleased with how everything turned out. Thank you D&K Suits!

name: scott winn
text: These people are stupid and I would not recommend doing business with them at all.  I specifically called ahead four days ago to make sure they could fit my son into a suit.  He takes a 34-36 small jacket but takes a 30 waist. He is thick thru the thigh area and I made it very clear to the clerk I dealt with on the phone of all of this.  This is the reply I got "Oh yeh, I know we deal with people like that all the time; it should be no problem finding him something that will work great for him; we can do alterations blah blah balh and we have over 10,000 suits so yeh, no problem send him over and we will get him fixed up."  Well guess what.......I 'sent him over' today from MS and GUESS WHAT.......the clerk TODAY told him they could not mix and match and they basically only had four, FOUR suits that would work for him.  He called me on the phone and told me that the suits they were showing him IF they used the jacket they were showing him, if he lifted up his arms the sleeves would slide down to the elbow.  So........he made a trip for nothing at the advice of some dumb clerk who know nothing about what SHE was talking about.  I've now sent him to Joseph Banks and/or other stores to look where we can deal with people who know how to sell clothes.   When I called to talk to someone today , this girl tried to tell me they could altar a suit coat from a 38 down to a 34.....now can you picture in your mind how that would look? She said 'well basically we would be remaking the entire jacket" .....um, ya think? And I would have had to pay for it. This store needs to first of all hire competent and informed personnel to adequately deal with people to prevent stupid things like this and cause someone an unnecessary trip to their 'big 10,000 usit store, for virtually nothing.  Evidently they DON'T work with people like this everyday or they would have been able to take care of him.  I wouldn't take my dog there now to buy a dog sweater if they sold them.  This is the most ignorant store I've ever dealt with.  If I could give a negative star I certainly would .  Please.....go spend your money at a competent store and don't waste your time with these people. They know nothing about what they do.

name: Adam Foutz
text:
I hate leaving bad reviews, but this store deserves it. I needed a new suit for a wedding, and went in to order my suit well in advance. A pair of pants had to be ordered, no big deal. After 3 weeks of not hearing anything from them, I called and was told "we'll call you back." No call back. So, I called again a few days later and spoke to the store manager. I was then told "I'll call you back before lunch." Guess what? No call back. I was up against a deadline, and gave them well over a month to get a PAIR OF PANTS in and get an entire suit tailored.

After calling numerous times, I physically went up to the store and got my money refunded. The manger was there and knew who I was, and offered to get it tailored same day. Too late, I ended up having to rent a suit for my event. I highly suggest going elsewhere to find a suit in Montgomery, this store is incompetent. Spend the extra money elsewhere.
